column2: We are seeking an experienced US IT Recruiter with expertise in recruiting for the K-Force account. This full-time position is based in Lucknow and Bangalore, India.                          Responsibilities:                   Collaborate closely with K-Force account managers and stakeholders to understand their staffing needs and requirements.        Source and attract top-tier IT professionals for roles specified by K-Force, including software developers, systems analysts, project managers, and IT consultants.        Utilize various sourcing methods such as job boards, social media, networking, referrals, and direct sourcing to identify qualified candidates.        Screen resumes, conduct initial phone interviews, and evaluate candidates technical skills, experience, and cultural fit for positions within the K-Force account.        Manage candidate pipelines and maintain accurate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS).        Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and K-Force clients, adhering to K-Forces process and requirements.        Provide necessary guidance and support to candidates throughout the interview process, ensuring a positive candidate experience.        Negotiate offers, facilitate the hiring process, and ensure a smooth transition for selected candidates.        Build and maintain strong relationships with candidates, ensuring long-term connections and referrals.        Understand and apply visa regulations and requirements, ensuring compliance with immigration laws throughout the recruitment process.        Familiarity with tax terms and employment regulations relevant to IT staffing in the US.                    Requirements:                   Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field preferred.        Proven experience as a US IT Recruiter, with a focus on recruiting for the K-Force account.        In-depth knowledge of the IT industry, including various technologies, programming languages, and IT job roles.        Familiarity with K-Forces staffing requirements, processes, and expectations.        Strong sourcing and networking skills, with the ability to identify and engage passive candidates.        Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish trust with candidates and clients.        Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.        Experience using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools.        Results-driven mindset with a commitment to meeting and exceeding recruitment targets and goals.
column11: Computer science, Business administration, Interpersonal skills, Networking, Staffing, Social media, Programming, HR, Management, Recruitment

column2: Must be willing to join immediate IT Recruiter Location: Bangalore, Karnataka Experience: 5+yrs Must be willing to join immediate Direct Contract for 12 months Position summary As a Recruiter you will source, screen and provide shortlists of qualified applicants for various technology, engineering and support related roles.  Primary responsibilities Partner/consult with hiring managers to develop and execute fulfillment strategies, source candidates, review resumes, conduct phone interviews, as well as contribute to hiring decisions.  Demonstrate value by understanding business needs and building strong customer relationships. Proactively network, cold-call, and penetrate passive candidate networks to build a candidate pool. Understand our talent strategy through your partnership with hiring managers including workforce planning, shaping requisitions and building compelling job postings. Assess candidate qualifications by looking beyond applications and finding the best candidates for our organization, leveraging multiple technologies and creative outlets.  Communicate labor market trends to educate hiring manager on the employment market and how it affects the candidate pool. Extend and negotiate offers of employment, looking for win-win solutions for both the candidate and our organization. Proactively contribute to the creating an exceptional experience for managers and candidates throughout the hiring process. Attend industry conferences and networking events with a plan to develop relationships and a network of referral sources. Train managers on our systems, tools, and policies related to talent acquisition. Use diverse sourcing techniques to recruit, and interview primarily without assistance of outside agencies. Drive recruiting process from requisition to closure in a timely and cost-effective manner. Advise hiring managers on compensation while taking into consideration the budget for the role, the annual budget for the department, as well as the candidates salary expectations and goals.  Perform other related duties as assigned. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND behaviors Ability to perform both tactical and strategic recruiting as a talent advisor.  Experience recruiting for highly specialized technical and non technical roles including candidates familiar with Data Science, Full stack, Engineering and Support Roles etc. Excellent relationship management skills, with proven ability to establish credibility and partner with business leaders to identify talent gaps and needs, and create and execute talent acquisition plans. Strong project management skills and the ability to execute fast-paced and high-volume recruitment efforts.  Experience recruiting in a legal and or technical environment is strongly preferred. Deep experience managing expectations for both candidates and business leaders. Strong customer-service orientation and influencing skills.  Expert knowledge of employment law, and working knowledge of current recruitment and talent sourcing practices and strategies, including use of social media and digital marketing.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Strategic, creative and innovative thinking skills, ability to exercise sound judgment.  Excellent organizational and time management skills. Ability to work successfully in a team environment as well as independently. Experience with Microsoft suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, Teams and Word. Experience using Applicant Tracking Systems such as ADP Workforce Now and social media tools required. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelors degree or equivalent experience. 3+years corporate and/or agency technical recruiting experience including sourcing and full life cycle recruiting and stakeholder management.

column2: Job Title: Technical Recruiter Experience Level: 1 to 3 years Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Technical Recruiter with 1 to 3 years of experience to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and recruiting top talent for our technical positions. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of technical roles, excellent communication skills, and a passion for connecting talented individuals with exciting career opportunities. Responsibilities: Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g., social platforms, professional networks) and offline methods (e.g., job fairs, networking events). Screen resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates for technical positions. Conduct phone and in-person interviews to assess candidates' technical skills, experience, and cultural fit. Coordinate with hiring managers to understand position requirements and develop effective recruitment strategies. Build and maintain a strong candidate pipeline for current and future hiring needs. Manage the entire recruitment process from initial contact to offer acceptance, ensuring a positive candidate experience. Utilize applicant tracking systems and other recruitment tools to track candidate progress and maintain accurate records. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new technologies to improve recruitment processes and attract top talent. Assist with other HR-related tasks and projects as needed. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 1 to 3 years of experience in technical recruiting, preferably in a fast-paced environment. Proven track record of successfully recruiting technical talent for various roles (e.g., software developers, engineers, IT professionals). Strong understanding of technical skills and experience with different programming languages, frameworks, and tools. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and build relationships with candidates and hiring managers. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a deadline-driven environment. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment software/tools. Passion for recruiting and a desire to contribute to the growth and success of the organization. This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated individual to take the next step in their recruiting career and make a significant impact within our organization.

column2: All the attributes that we are looking for in an ideal teammate.         Openness   - We welcome people from different backgrounds and schools of thought, Terraformers are open to different perspectives in approaching a solution and not just limit their thoughts or ideas to only a specific domain       Conscientiousness   - We believe in working together for the larger goal and with complete dedication and not just for personal benefits, however we do not expect terraformers to work to the point of burnout       Humility-    Being humble, grateful and respectful are the core traits of terraformers, we do not expect people to agree with every view of the management, feel free to have a different perspective but we always expect it to be put forward with respect       Risk Takers-    Terraformers are not afraid of the unknown and are open to new things, not that we encourage extreme risks without weighing the consequences but we are ones who take calculated risks       Autodidacts-    Terraformers teach themselves to learn, we do our own research to get solutions, we do not expect you to have a blank slate and figure everything out yourself, we are here to guide you but not handhold and micromanage you       Self-Actualization-    Terraformers are on the path of self-actualization, we are not bothered by the noise and distractions around us, we only work towards achieving our full potential. We do not expect you to over-burden yourself and not have fun but we expect you to work to the best of your capabilities               Roles, Responsibilities Expectations               Plan, organize, and manage multiple calendars.     Actively involved in the hiring process from crafting the alluring job description and generating enough intrigue and excitement around the role to interviewing the candidates for interpersonal skills and coordinating with departments throughout the process and interviews.     Maintain and develop a pipeline of eligible candidates for future open positions     Qualify or reject candidates based on interview feedback and resume reviews     Serve as the contact person for questions from candidates     Manage the hiring process with respect to the candidate and Nbyula team communication and feedback     Manage and organize the employee data and recruitment-related dashboards     Plan and execute team engagement activities     Driving campus recruitment               Skills Personality Attributes               Effective communication skills     Strong organizational and interpersonal skills     Experience working with the Google suite     High-energy and passion     Prior recruitment experience working in the software sector is preferred     Strong ownership, drive, and the experience of working independently in unstructured environments     Ability to work closely with cross-functional teams within tight timelines to execute decisions

Ultimately, you will create a competitive attraction and sourcing strategy to build strong talent pipelines for our company s current and future hiring needs. column2: The right candidate must be able to successfully manage a full cycle recruiting, prioritize and achieve hiring goal against a timeline and have experience setting benchmarks, metrics, and understand how to prioritize to hit for all team SLAs.                                  Ability to thrive in an innovative, fast-paced environment, hands-on roll up their sleeves, work hard, have fun, and get the job done are equally important.                  The best candidates will draw on extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business, forging dynamic relationships with our various Technology, Engineering, Data Science and Product business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners.                  Responsibilities        Manage end-to-end recruiting including research, sourcing, candidate assessment & management, offer recommendation, negotiation & acceptance      Manage complex searches and use data to advise the business on industry trends      Develop partnerships and build relationships at all levels both internally and externally      Support multiple functions at all levels across the enterprise      Build effective sourcing and recruiting strategies to attract and engage talent for open positions      Partner with senior leaders across the organization to understand their hiring objectives and develop team recruiting strategies to hit headcount goals      Track and analyze metrics and report on hiring progress to business leadership on a regular cadence      Provide a consistent and positive candidate experience throughout the entire recruiting process with proactive communication and engagement      Utilize ATS reports, dashboards, and other tools to illustrate and influence the recruiting pipeline and results      Become the subject matter expert on the business/client you support      Lend a hand to support overflow requisitions from other teams as needed.                Requirements        5+ years of full-cycle technical recruiting experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with preference for AI, Data Science, ML and NLP skills      BA/BS (or International equivalent) in Computer Science, Business or related experience      A passion for building teams and delivering exceptional candidate experience      Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an appropriate blend of professionalism and friendliness      Proven abilities to attract passive candidates and build a diverse pipelines      Data driven approach to problem solving; make sense of the trends and using the insights to better the process and make it more efficient      A growth mindset and truly flexible. Shift tasks and priorities when circumstances change (at a fast-growing startup, things frequently change)      An interest in working in a cross-functional and fluid environment.                Good to have        Campus recruitment experience.

column2: Job Title:  US IT Bench Sales Recruiter/Team Leader Location:  Work from Home (USA Timings) Company Name:  Hach Technologies  Job Type:  Full-time ( Remote) Experience Required:  Genuine 1 year of experience in US IT Bench Sales Recruitment and Admin Process Immediate Start:  Candidate should be ready to start immediately Salary:  Starting from 15,000 INR per month (Incentives) Job Description: Hach Technologies is seeking experienced and motivated US IT Bench Sales Recruiters and Team Leaders to join our growing team. The ideal candidates will have at least 1 year of genuine experience in US IT Bench Sales Recruitment and Admin Process. This is a full-time position with the flexibility of working from home according to USA timings. Responsibilities: For US IT Bench Sales Recruiters: Source, screen, and recruit qualified candidates for US IT bench sales positions. Manage the administrative process related to bench sales recruitment. Monitor candidate progress and maintain accurate records. For Team Leaders: Lead and mentor a team of US IT       Bench Sales Recruiters Set goals, provide training, and monitor performance. Ensure team targets are met and maintain team morale Collaborate with senior management to develop recruitment strategies. Requirements: Genuine 1 year of experience in      US IT Bench Sales Recruitment and Admin Process. Strong leadership and      communication skills (for Team Leader role) Ability to work independently and meet targets. Familiarity with job portals, recruiting tools, and USA timings. Bachelor's degree in a relevant field is preferred. Benefits: Competitive salary starting from      15,000 INR per month, excluding performance incentives. Work from home flexibility according to USA timings. Health insurance and other benefits. Opportunities for career growth and development in a fast-growing startup environment. If you meet the above requirements and are ready to start immediately, please submit your resume and cover letter to hachion.trainings@gmail.com

column2: Join Our Team! Bench Sales Recruiters Needed at Axzora Resourcing Are you passionate about recruitment and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? Axzora Resourcing, located in Nagole, Hyderabad, is seeking motivated Bench Sales Recruiters to join our US Staffing team. About Us: Axzora Resourcing is a leading staffing and recruitment firm specializing in US IT staffing solutions. We work with top-tier clients across various industries, providing staffing services that meet their evolving needs. Position: Bench Sales Recruiter Location:  Nagole, Hyderabad Experience:  2+ years in US Staffing (Bench Sales) Employment Type:  Full-time Responsibilities: Engage      in bench sales activities, including sourcing, screening, and placing      candidates on various IT projects with client companies. Develop      and maintain relationships with bench candidates and vendors to facilitate      successful placements. Utilize      various job boards, social media platforms, and networking avenues to      identify potential candidates. Negotiate      compensation and benefits packages, ensuring competitive offers to      candidates. Collaborate      with account managers and recruiters to align candidate qualifications      with client requirements. Track      and report on candidate progress, pipeline status, and placement outcomes. Stay      updated on industry trends and market demands to adapt recruitment      strategies accordingly. Requirements: Minimum      2 years of experience in US Staffing, specifically in bench      sales/recruitment. Strong      understanding of the US IT staffing industry and bench sales process. Proven      track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets and placement goals. Excellent      communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport      and establish relationships. Proficient      in using job boards (Dice, Monster, LinkedIn, etc.) and applicant tracking      systems (ATS). Ability      to thrive in a goal-oriented, deadline-driven environment. Why Join Axzora Resourcing? Competitive      salary and performance-based incentives. Opportunity      for career growth and professional development. Collaborative      and supportive team environment. Access      to top-tier clients and exciting projects in the IT industry. If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for US Staffing and bench sales, we want to hear from you! Join us at Axzora Resourcing and be part of a dynamic team driving success in the staffing industry.

column2: Position: Bench Sales Specialist Location: Hyderabad (On-site/Hybrid) Type: Full time Timings: 6:30 PM  3:30 AM (IST) Experience: 3+ years About the Role: We are seeking a dynamic Bench Sales Specialist with a proven track record in the US IT staffing. The ideal candidate will have expertise in sourcing contract roles for IT professionals currently on the bench, particularly in areas such as Java, .NET, QA, SDET, DevOps, Data Engineering, and Python. This role involves strategic coordination with prime vendors, utilizing platforms like LinkedIn and other job portals to secure opportunities for our bench candidates. Key Responsibilities: Identify contract positions suitable for candidates on the bench, focusing on areas like Java, .NET, QA, SDET, DevOps, Data Engineering, and Python. Build and maintain relationships with prime vendors to uncover new opportunities and submit bench profiles for consideration. Leverage LinkedIn and other job portals effectively to find potential positions for bench candidates. Work closely with candidates to assist in the application process for identified positions. Diligently follow up on candidate submissions with both the candidate and the vendor to ensure timely updates and feedback. Guide candidates in tailoring their resumes to align with specific job descriptions, enhancing their chances of selection. Skilfully negotiate pay rates with vendors to secure the best possible terms for our candidates. Serve as a liaison between vendors and candidates, coordinating interview schedules and ensuring smooth communication throughout the hiring process. Preferred candidate profile   Proven experience in bench sales, particularly within the IT staffing industry. Strong network and relationships with prime vendors in the IT sector. Excellent communication and negotiation skills. Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and follow-up skills. Should be ready to work in US Timing (Night Shift)

column2: TO APPLY, PLEASE RIGHT CLICK THE LINK:  https://app.testedrecruits.com/posting/12893 Roles and Responsibilities   Drafting and posting job ads Reviewing resumes and screening candidates Scheduling interviews and skills tests by coordinating appointments Conducting interviews with candidates either in person, over the phone, or through Skype Administering skills tests Inputting, updating and maintaining data in the recruiting database Conducting exit interviews in the event that an employee leaves the company Assisting management with personnel issues and employee development Assisting management with organizing and coordinating employee training workshops Planning and executing company events Protecting operations by keeping human resource information confidential Providing horizontal support to other staff members of the recruitment team Desired Candidate Profile   Prior experience with recruitment, sourcing, screening, hiring etc. International recruiting experience is a plus Passion for recruitment and human resources Great interpersonal, analytical, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, decision-making, and conflict resolution skills The ability to stay highly organized with great attention to detail The ability to maintain strict confidentiality and discretion Excellent written and spoken English The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST Passion to build a startup An outgoing and friendly disposition Reliable transportation if working in-house A reliable workstation with a fast computer, microphone and speakers, reliable internet and power if working remotely Perks and Benefits   Coalition Technologies is devoted to delivering clients the highest quality work while providing our team a fun, thriving, and innovative environment. Along with the opportunity for tremendous career growth and rapid advancement, CT offers: The most competitive profit-sharing bonus plan in the industry, paying up to 50% of company profits to full-time employees each month! A highly competitive Paid Time Off plan, promoting quality work-life balance. Subsidized gym memberships to help team members feel their best. Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages for all US-based team members. International Health Insurance Reimbursement Program for all international team members, a benefit unique to Coalition. Device upgrade and learning reimbursement programs. Motivating career development plans with clearly defined goals and rewards. Additional job-specific incentives and bonuses. Plus, 100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking software. Our company culture specializes in supporting remote team members, and weve been doing so for more than a decade. CT welcomes your application, wherever in the world it's coming from! TO APPLY, PLEASE RIGHT CLICK THE LINK:  https://app.testedrecruits.com/posting/12893

column2: About Forsys:  Forsys is a global technology firm providing a wide spectrum of enterprise, cloud, and analytics services.  It was incorporated in 2010 with an aim to provide quality services in the field of software solutions, including front, middle and back-office systems.  Forsys prime offerings are in the areas of Cloud and Analytics, Supply Chain Management, ERP Financials, Customer Experience, and Relationship Management, Quote-to-cash and Data Migration Position : Sr.IT Recruiter Experience : 6-9 years Location : Hyderabad  Role Description: This is a full-time on-site role as a Senior Information Technology Recruiter. As a Senior IT Recruiter, you will be responsible for full-life cycle recruiting and hiring of IT professionals. This includes technical recruiting, sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selecting candidates that meet the organization's needs. The role also involves building and maintaining relationships with candidates, clients, and stakeholders. Required Skills: 6-9 years experience in Full-life Cycle Recruiting. Experience in  technical recruiting and hiring, we prefer Salesforce. Should have experience in IT Recruitment and End-to-End Recruitment. Excellent sourcing and screening skills from Naukri, LinkedIn, and other mediums.  Sourcing, Screening and Selecting qualified IT professionals to meet the organizational fit. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their specific hiring requirements and provide support throughout the hiring process. Any Graduation with  strong communication skills.

column2: Access Global Group is seeking a Bench Sales (US Technical) for this fully remote, India-Based, direct-hire role to join our growing Recruitment Team. Important notes: US technical staffing bench sales experience required. This is a direct-hire FULLY REMOTE, India-Based position - EST Hours. No 3rd party engagement TO APPLY: (PLEASE ENSURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS) Review and Apply today,  navigate to: www.acsgbl.com/careers Locate Job Posting: " Bench Sales " > Click " APPLY NOW " AGG Prides itself on our reputation and skilled talent. Our potential team members must possess the following skills: MUST have extensive Staffing Bench Sales experience MUST be a strong relationship builder, capable of connecting with new clients An fast paced - ambitious attitude, relentlessly committed to helping top talent Strategizes and Efficiently Organizes Work Utilizes Compelling Descriptors to Highlight and Capitalize on Talents' Skills Communicates with Profound Effectiveness Possesses Astute Talent Management and Understanding Achieves Exemplary Results Demonstrates Agility and Adaptability Resolves Complex Problems Devotes Attention to Clients and Candidates Embraces Risks and Grasps Opportunities Description: As a Bench Sales (US Technical), you will play a pivotal role in expanding our client base and fostering new business relationships in the IT staffing industry as well as placing our Bench. Prior experience of 5 yrs with US IT Staffing Companies is Mandatory Develop and implement effective sales strategies to acquire new clients and expand our business within the US staffing industry. Proven track record in business development, client acquisition, and US Bench staffing. Should be a lead, set clear goals, and help team members understand their jobs Should communicate openly and encourage teamwork and growth. Motivate teams work that benefits on reaching the company's goals. Manage use facts and numbers to measure how well the team is doing. Then use this information to make smart decisions and suggest changes. Good understanding of VMS (Vendor Managed Systems) business Identify potential clients, understand their needs, and offer tailored staffing solutions. Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and key decision-makers. Collaborate with our US Bench Sales team to ensure timely delivery of high-quality staffing solutions. Negotiate contracts and agreements to ensure mutually beneficial partnerships. Meet and exceed sales targets and objectives. Strong understanding of the US Bench staffing industry, including the latest trends and challenges. Exceptional communication and negotiation skills. Self-motivated and results-oriented with a focus on exceeding sales targets. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Qualifications: 5-7+ years of proven Bench Sales (US Technical) experience specifically in the US IT staffing industry. Hands on Sales - this is a direct contributor position Proven track record of acquiring new clients with prior relationships with Implementation Partners and Direct Clients. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English. Passionate, energetic, enthusiastic, and proactive attitude. Self-driven, motivated, professional, and positive-minded. Proven track record meeting sales objectives by identifying, developing, and closing staffing opportunities. Entrepreneurial attitude and strong business acumen. Strong consulting, analytical, problem-solving, and relationship-building skills. A minimum of a Bachelors or equivalent degree / Masters in Business is preferred. Company's website:   https://acsgbl.com Job Type : Full-time - Remote - EST Hours Benefits (for full-time employees): Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off

column2: To continue our record-breaking customer and employee growth, Planful is looking for a seasoned Technical Recruiter specializing in strategic R&D roles to identify top talent and own the end-to-end recruitment process. Reporting to the Director of Recruiting, this Technical Recruiter will be a key player in all engineering hiring out of our India region. You ll work as a business partner to hiring managers, maintaining a best-in-class candidate experience from outbound outreach to post-offer acceptance. We hire A-players who pride themselves on the quality and code of ethics in which they work, and tie our vetting process to The Planful Way: our shared values and defined mission that guide our efforts in the company.     Our small but mighty recruiting department works with the philosophy that we win as a team. While you ll be individually responsible for managing specific role pipeline/Business Partnership, we re proud of the culture we ve built to trade market knowledge, celebrate one another s wins and problem-solve in the moments that need it.     Top performers in Planful Recruitment operate with extreme passion & ownership over the work they do, paired with genuine humility and an ever-learning mindset. See below for more insight into the day-to-day operations of a Planful recruiter, and what we re looking for in our newest teammate.     This is a full-time role based out of our Hyderabad, India office.          Requirements         Tangible experience       5+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience     Strong preference for experience within the SaaS/tech industry     Proven success leading end-to-end searches from entry-level to leadership      Technical-specific recruiting experience (SDET, QA, Principal Architect, Scrummaster, Lead Engineer, Machine Learning, etc) is a must     Proficiency in LinkedIn Recruiter and Greenhouse ATS     Ability to manage competing priorities and multiple searches (typically 5-8 requisitions) at any time       Intangible qualities       Ask thoughtful questions to support learning, communicate openly with your team and manager     A keen sense of organization and an eye for detail     Proactively raise questions or issues to recruiting leadership and are motivated to ask questions and learn more through observation or your own research     Enthusiastic about shaping internal processes and see your big-picture of our work impacting company goals      Passionate about providing an elite candidate experience and hiring best-in-class talent to scale the company     You re a bar-raiser everything we do is with intention and are constantly improving to elevate ourselves, the candidate experience, and ultimately identify the best-in-class talent to raise the bar for our individual work and Planful as a company           Responsibilities         Candidate Partnership         Manage full-cycle, white glove recruitment process (prospecting passive candidates to offer close) of 5-8 individual requisitions at a given time     Innovate and operationalize creative sourcing strategies to deliver diverse and competitive talent to Planful we care much more about the quality of the people we bring on board than the number of interviews we hold     Effectively align candidates motivations with Planful s value proposition, roles, and expectations     Be a skilled negotiator in the delivery of employment offers      Create and maintain a uniquely competitive and intentional candidate experience our top priority is to deliver a best-in-class experience to match the top talent we work with         Internal Business Partnership         Partner with Hiring Managers to deeply understand requirements/qualifications for all job profiles, nice to haves to further elevate the talent pipeline, and properly excite candidates about Planful and the specific roles you re responsible for     Work as a market expert on all things R&D talent, staying up to date with industry trends, technical aptitude needed for the nuances of each role/team.     Act as a partner to the business in identifying the right talent and proactively course-correct to continuously improve every process     Guide both new and tenured leaders on recruitment best practices and equip them with the tools and expertise to be as strong of an interviewer as we are recruiters     Proactively lean into data trends and market insights to inform leaders of the candidate pool, state of the market, and offer guidance for the searches you re running, Data can come from the wider talent market, but more importantly the internal data we re tracking within the Planful recruitment ecosystem on a daily basis         Data Hygiene         Daily management and real-time updates of pipeline in our tech stack (Greenhouse data tracking, Strategic Sourcing tracking documents for HM view)     Provide regular updates and incorporate input within each project we need self-starters who are proactive about their own growth as well as new organizational ideas on how to iterate on our current hiring process

column1: Senior Technical Recruiter - Work FROM Home
column2: Job Description:  Senior Domestic Technical Recruiter Position Overview:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Domestic Technical Recruiter to join our dynamic  HR team. As a Senior Technical Recruiter, you will play a crucial role in identifying, attracting, and hiring  top-tier technical talent for our organization. The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 3 years  of hands-on experience in technical recruitment, with a deep understanding of the domestic job market  and its trends.  Responsibilities:  ??Full-Cycle Recruitment: Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, from sourcing and  screening candidates to negotiating offers and onboarding.  ??Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing strategies, including job boards, social media, networking, and  referrals, to identify and engage with potential candidates.  ??Candidate Evaluation: Conduct thorough assessments of candidates' technical skills,  qualifications, and cultural fit through interviews, technical assessments, and reference checks.  ??Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, salary benchmarks, and competitive  landscape to provide insights and recommendations to hiring managers.  ??Collaboration: Partner closely with hiring managers to understand their technical staffing needs  and develop effective recruitment strategies.  ??Candidate Experience: Ensure a positive and efficient experience for candidates throughout the  recruitment process, providing timely feedback and maintaining clear communication.  ??Talent Pools: Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified technical candidates for current and  future hiring needs.  ??Data-Driven Approach: Regularly analyze recruitment metrics and data to measure the  effectiveness of sourcing strategies, identify areas for improvement, and implement solutions.  ??Employer Branding: Contribute to enhancing the company's employer brand by representing the  organization positively and professionally to potential candidates.  ??Process Improvement: Continuously refine and optimize the recruitment process to enhance  efficiency, effectiveness, and candidate satisfaction.  ??Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior recruiters or team members as needed.  Qualifications:  ??Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in technical recruitment, preferably in a domestic  setting.  ??Technical Expertise: Strong understanding of technical roles, skills, and terminology to effectively  assess candidates' qualifications.  ??Networking: Proven ability to build and maintain a network of technical professionals through  events, online platforms, and industry connections.  ??Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey  complex technical information clearly.  ??Negotiation Skills: Demonstrated experience in negotiating offers and closing candidates  successfully.  ??Problem-Solving: Ability to creatively solve recruitment challenges and adapt to changing market  conditions.  ??Data-Driven: Comfortable using data to drive decisions and measure recruitment performance. ??Team Player: Collaborative approach to working with hiring managers, team members, and  cross-functional partners.  ??Adaptability: Flexible and adaptable to a fast-paced and evolving work environment. ??Bachelor's Degree: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field is preferred. Benefits: ??Competitive salary and performance-based incentives ??Comprehensive health and wellness benefits  ??Professional development opportunities ??Positive and inclusive work environment  ??Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and top-tier clients  If interested share your resume at shivani.koshti@imsplgroup.com

column2: Job Title: IT Recruiter (Junior) Location: Bengaluru, KA 560043 - Work from Office Day Shift/ Full Time Role . Job Description: As a IT Recruiter at Invisia, you will play a vital role in our talent acquisition strategy, ensuring we attract, assess and hire top-tier IT professionals to support our company's growth and success. This Position offers an exciting opportunity to lead recruitment efforts, collaborate with hiring managers, and contribute to building a dynamic and diverse team of technology experts. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in human resources, Business Administration or a related field. Responsibilities: Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing techniques including job boards, social media, networking events, and referrals to identify and attract top IT talents. Recruitment: Manage the end-to-end recruitment process including job posting, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and coordinating technical assessments. Candidate Management: Build and maintain relationships with candidates to ensure a positive candidate experience. Collaboration: Partner with hiring managers and technical leads to understand staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, market conditions, and competitive intelligence to inform recruitment strategies and tactics. Negotiation: Manage salary negotiations and offer extensions to ensure competitive offers that meet both candidate and company expectation.  Onboarding: Coordinate the onboarding process for new hires, including background checks, paperwork, and orientation sessions. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field.  Proven experience of 5+ as an IT Recruiter, preferably in a senior or lead role. In-Depth Knowledge of IT Roles, technologies and skillsets. Strong sourcing and networking skills with the ability to identify and attract passive candidates. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport with candidates and hiring managers. Demo started ability to manage multiple recruitment projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. Experience with application tracking system (ATS) and other recruitment tools. Strong organizational and time management skills with attention to detail. If you are a passionate IT Recruiter with expertise in Recruitment, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our company by recruiting top IT Talent!. column2: Job Title: Senior US IT Recruiter (Night Shift) Location: Noida Sector 62, Rajouri  Job Type: Full-Time, Night Shift Company: Texas Review  Job Description: We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Senior US IT Recruiter to join our team for the night shift. As a Senior US IT Recruiter, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and placing qualified IT professionals for our clients across the United States. This role requires strong recruitment expertise, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of the US IT job market. Responsibilities: Source and recruit IT professionals for a variety of positions, including developers, engineers, architects, project managers, and more, using various sourcing methods such as job boards, social media, networking, and referrals. Screen candidates' resumes, conduct technical interviews, and evaluate their skills, experience, and suitability for client requirements. Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates, proactively sourcing and engaging passive candidates for current and future job opportunities. Partner with account managers and clients to understand their staffing needs, develop recruitment strategies, and deliver high-quality candidates in a timely manner. Negotiate offer terms, manage candidate expectations, and facilitate the hiring process from initial contact to onboarding. Provide regular updates and reports on recruitment activities, candidate pipeline, and placement metrics to management and stakeholders. Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and market developments to identify new recruitment opportunities and strategies. Mentor and coach junior recruiters, providing guidance, support, and training to help them develop their skills and succeed in their roles. Requirements: Master's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience as a US IT Recruiter, with a proven track record of success in full-cycle recruitment for IT positions. Strong understanding of the US IT job market, including technologies, trends, and talent availability. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with candidates, clients, and internal stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to source and engage passive candidates, build relationships, and influence decision-making. Proficiency in using recruitment tools and technology platforms, including Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and job boards. Results-oriented mindset with a focus on meeting and exceeding recruitment targets and goals. Ability to work independently and prioritise tasks effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Flexibility to work night shifts as per the company's business requirements. To apply, please submit your resume to  chelsi.jain@texasreview.in  / 7701855915

column2: Job Title :    OPT Recruiter (Night Shift) Location:     Noida Sector 62, Rajouri Garden ( Delhi )  Job Type:    Full-Time, Night Shift Company:   Texas Review (  www.texasreview.in  ) Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and motivated OPT Recruiter to join our team for the night shift. As an OPT Recruiter, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and placing international students on Optional Practical Training (OPT) status into various IT positions across the United States. This role requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and a deep understanding of OPT regulations and the IT job market. Responsibilities: Source and recruit international students on OPT status for IT job opportunities through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals. Screen candidates' resumes and conduct initial interviews to assess qualifications, skills, and eligibility for OPT employment. Provide guidance and support to candidates throughout the job search process, including resume writing, interview preparation, and visa documentation. Build and maintain relationships with candidates, educational institutions, and OPT advisors to expand the candidate pipeline and enhance recruitment efforts. Collaborate with account managers and clients to understand job requirements and match qualified candidates with suitable job opportunities. Facilitate the placement process, including coordinating interviews, negotiating offers, and ensuring a smooth onboarding experience for candidates. Stay updated on OPT regulations, immigration policies, and industry trends to provide accurate information and guidance to candidates and clients. Maintain accurate records of candidate interactions, job placements, and compliance documentation in the recruitment database. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in IT recruitment, with a focus on hiring OPT candidates preferred. Strong understanding of OPT regulations, F-1 visa status, and immigration processes related to employment authorization for international students. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively interact with candidates, clients, and internal stakeholders. Proven track record of sourcing and placing candidates in IT positions, preferably in a fast-paced recruitment environment. Ability to work independently and prioritise tasks effectively in a dynamic and deadline-driven environment. Proficiency in using recruitment tools and software, including Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and job boards. Flexibility to work night shifts as per the company's business requirements. Apply only if you are able to work the night shift. To apply, please submit your resume to  chelsi.jain@texasreview.in  / 7701855915

column2: About the role: Department - HR Type of work - Full-time (6 month contract) Location - Jhandewalan, New Delhi (Onsite) Working days - 6 days a week Apply here - https://bit.ly/49D4NhG What you can expect from the role: Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g. social platforms and professional networks) Foster long-term relationships with past applicants and potential candidates Keeping track of all the open positions at partner companies Keeping track of and updating positions on the  Job Portal Must-Have: 4+ years of experience in end-to-end tech recruitment Solid English communication (both written and verbal) Self-learning and self-initiating attitude with attention to detail Good sourcing and understanding of profiles - Full-Stack Developers/Product Managers/QA/Game Developers, etc Experience working on different job portals and open to exploring new portals as well Good time management skills Fluency with excel/google sheets or related software Good to have: Strong networking & relationship building skills Experience of hiring in Gaming Ecosystem (good to have, not mandatory) Someone who can take ownership over the tasks allotted to them Why you might be excited about us: We are a funded start-up, recently closed our seed funding with Kalaari Capital and with few renowned investors in past like - Village global, FirstCheque, some experience founders such as Anand (FB, Snapdeal), Srini (Founder, TutorVista), Ambareesh (Founder, Pepperfry) and many more! Were tackling a big problem with an even bigger potential to become a launchpad for the entire game industry globally. Participants in our existing cohorts say great things about us! Innovative Industry:  Be part of a company that operates at the intersection of gaming, education, and employment in the gaming sector, contributing to innovative solutions in these spaces. Collaborative Culture:  Experience a collaborative and inclusive work culture where your ideas are valued, and you can make a real difference. Passionate Team:  Work alongside a team of passionate professionals dedicated to making a positive impact in the gaming ed-tech and job portal domains. Compensation & Benefits: This role comes with: ?Competitive Salary ?Varied and challenging role. What we expect: You need to  stay active and keep an eye on the regular updates Efficient  time management  is encouraged Take ownership of your work and can work independently on assigned projects/tasks. column2: TMV Global India Private Limited  is hiring 10 Technical Recruiters for US Staffing Clients. This is a Full time job with Night Shifts (6:30 PM to 3:30 AM), 5 Days a week, can be converted to Work From Home after performance evaluation. Interested Candidates are required to send their resumes for scheduling an interview. Job Description: Technical Recruiter is required to source potential candidates from various databases, portals, job boards and social media platforms. Technical Recruiters should be able to perform pre-screening calls to analyse applicant's abilities and should be able to get the authentication done by getting the required documents from them. Should be able to negotiate pay rates and terms with US Citizen, and Green Card Holder candidates. Should be able to manage all stages of the recruitment process for both clients and candidates. Required Skills: Should have 2.5-6 years of professional US IT Recruitment experience. Should be able to work in Night Shifts (6:30 PM to 3:30 AM). Should have excellent communication and active listening skills. Should be able to converse with Native speakers of English. Should have knowledge about various Software Technologies and Tools. Should have expertise in using various sourcing methods including traditional job boards, social media, networking, web-mining, and cold-calling. Demonstrated ability in hiring candidates across geographies within the US Good understanding of US Staffing statutory requirements, HR and contracting process, pay rates etc. Should have Experience in hiring W2/Full Time Candidates. Ability to work on multiple requirements and source quality profiles. Familiar with all sourcing documentation (NDA/MSA/PO/COI etc).

column2: TO APPLY, PLEASE RIGHT CLICK THE LINK:  https://app.testedrecruits.com/posting/12893 Roles and Responsibilities   Drafting and posting job ads Reviewing resumes and screening candidates Scheduling interviews and skills tests by coordinating appointments Conducting interviews with candidates either in person, over the phone, or through Skype Administering skills tests Inputting, updating and maintaining data in the recruiting database Conducting exit interviews in the event that an employee leaves the company Assisting management with personnel issues and employee development Assisting management with organizing and coordinating employee training workshops Planning and executing company events Protecting operations by keeping human resource information confidential Providing horizontal support to other staff members of the recruitment team Desired Candidate Profile   Prior experience with recruitment, sourcing, screening, hiring etc. International recruiting experience is a plus Passion for recruitment and human resources Great interpersonal, analytical, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, decision-making, and conflict resolution skills The ability to stay highly organized with great attention to detail The ability to maintain strict confidentiality and discretion Excellent written and spoken English The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST Passion to build a startup An outgoing and friendly disposition Reliable transportation if working in-house A reliable workstation with a fast computer, microphone and speakers, reliable internet and power if working remotely Perks and Benefits   Coalition Technologies is devoted to delivering clients the highest quality work while providing our team a fun, thriving, and innovative environment. Along with the opportunity for tremendous career growth and rapid advancement, CT offers: The most competitive profit-sharing bonus plan in the industry, paying up to 50% of company profits to full-time employees each month! A highly competitive Paid Time Off plan, promoting quality work-life balance. Subsidized gym memberships to help team members feel their best. Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages for all US-based team members. International Health Insurance Reimbursement Program for all international team members, a benefit unique to Coalition. Device upgrade and learning reimbursement programs. Motivating career development plans with clearly defined goals and rewards. Additional job-specific incentives and bonuses. Plus, 100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking software. Our company culture specializes in supporting remote team members, and weve been doing so for more than a decade. CT welcomes your application, wherever in the world it's coming from! TO APPLY, PLEASE RIGHT CLICK THE LINK:  https://app.testedrecruits.com/posting/12893

column2: Our client is a US Head quartered  Big 10 firm  having India operations for the last 15 years. Planning a major expansion. Looking for dynamic candidates who has good expertise in IT recruitment.    Location : Mumbai with their office in Goregoan (E)   - Full time MBA is a must. Interested candidates must contact S Krishnan at 8309618146 We are looking for an IT recruitment specialist, who has an eye for sourcing, and closing good tech talent. A great track record and expertise in hiring technical roles and must be from the IT industry. We are interested in someone who is smart, dedicated, a quick learner, and a great cultural fit for our team.   What you will be doing: Spearhead recruitment and take ownership of recruitment requirements. Manage end to end recruitment process including: sourcing and screening resumes, selecting candidates for interview, conducting interview kick-offs and debrief sessions, negotiate offers, managing offer approval process, extending offers and rejecting candidates, onboarding and fully integrating as employees. Handling coordination and communications within the team and helping in preparing schedules for recruitment activities and their execution. Assess applicants' relevant knowledge, skills, soft skills, experience, aptitudes and culture fit. Manage ongoing candidate relationship, all through the hiring life cycle and provide exemplary candidate experience. Plan and conduct post-offer pursuit activities for candidate engagement until they join (e.g., communications, schedule meet and greet with current employees, answering questions etc. ) Prepare interviewers for interviews, transitioning relevant candidate-specific information Verbally extend offers of employment and leverage on manager for guidance around complex negotiations Network within the marketplace to understand competitive landscape and compensation practices Continuously build and strengthen relationships with internal stakeholders Work with marketing team to Implement new and innovative methods for brand awareness. Maintain trackers of information and other data for record keeping and analytics. Use analytics for identifying area of improvement in recruitment processes and strategies.     What You'll Need: MBA or Equivalent Degree / Bachelors Degree Experience of 5+ Years Strong experience in  technology recruiting. Good knowledge of technology trends, compensation and benefits Strong oral and written communication skills. Attention to detail and ensuring accuracy Proficiency in MS- Office. Familiarity with HR databases, Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and Candidate Management Systems (CMS) etc.

column2: Position   :   HR   Executive Department   :   Human   Resource   JOB   DescriptionJob   Description: The   HR   Executive   will   be   responsible   for   managing   all   aspects   of   the   company's   human   resources   operations.   This includes   developing   and   implementing   HR   policies   and   procedures,   managing   employee   relations,   recruiting, compensation   and   benefits,   compliance   with   employment   laws   and   regulations,   training   and   development,   and performance   management.   The   HR   Executive   will   report   to   the   Director   and   work   closely   with   the   senior   management team   to   ensure   alignment   with   company   goals   and   objectives. Tasks   and   responsibilities: ?? Develop   and   implement   HR   policies   and   procedures   to   ensure   compliance   with   legal   requirements   and company   standards. ?? Manage   employee   relations,   including   conflict   resolution,   investigations,   and   counseling   to   ensure   a   positive work   environment. ?? Recruit,   screen,   and   interview   candidates   to   fill   open   positions   within   the   company. ?? Develop   and   maintain   job   descriptions   and   conduct   performance   evaluations   to   ensure   alignment   with   company   goals   and   objectives. ?? Manage   compensation   and   benefits   programs,   including   payroll   processing,   employee   benefits,   and   retirement plans. ?? Ensure   compliance   with   federal,   state,   and   local   employment   laws   and   regulations,   including   EEO,   ADA,   and FMLA. ?? Provide   training   and   development   opportunities   for   employees   to   enhance   their   skills   and   knowledge. ?? Maintain   accurate   and   up-to-date   employee   records,   including   personnel   files,   benefits   information,   and   attendance   records. ?? Conduct   exit   interviews   and   maintain   data   on   employee   turnover   and   retention   to   identify   trends   and opportunities   for   improvement. ?? Collaborate   with   management   to   develop   and   implement   strategic   initiatives   to   improve   organizational effectiveness   and   achieve   business   objectives.  ?? Key   skills   and   qualifications   of   a   Sales   Executive: Qualifications : ?? Bachelor's   degree   in   HR   or   related   field. ?? 1+   years   of   experience   in   HR   management. ?? Strong   knowledge   of   employment   laws   and   regulations. ?? Excellent   communication   and   interpersonal   skills. ?? Strong   problem-solving   and   conflict   resolution   skills. ?? Demonstrated   ability   to   manage   multiple   priorities   and   deadlines. ?? Proficiency   in   Microsoft   Office   and   HRIS   systems. To   apply   for   this   position,   please   email   your   CV,   a   covering   letter   stating   your   salary   expectations   and   example   of published   work   to   hr@modgensolutions.com   Please   state   clearly   in   the   subject   line   which   post   you   are   applying   for.

column2: Partner with hiring managers to understand their technical staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies.                     Candidates must have substantial experience in contract staffing or contract-to-hire(C2H) roles.                     Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals, to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates.                     Screen resumes, conduct phone interviews, and assess candidates technical skills and qualifications.                     Coordinate and conduct in-depth technical interviews, evaluating candidates technical proficiency and cultural fit.                     Manage the interview process, including scheduling interviews, gathering feedback, and making recommendations to hiring managers.                     Negotiate and extend job offers to select candidates, ensuring competitive compensation packages and addressing any concerns or questions.                     Develop and maintain strong relationships with candidates, providing a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.                     Collaborate with hiring managers and HR team members to develop and implement effective recruitment strategies and processes.                     Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and innovative recruitment techniques to continuously improve the recruitment process.                     Minimum Requirements:                        Proven experience as a Technical Recruiter, preferably in the technology industry.                     Strong understanding of technical roles and requirements, including software engineering, data science, IT, or related fields.                     Demonstrated success in sourcing and attracting top technical talent using a variety of recruitment methods.                     Experience conducting technical interviews and evaluating candidates technical skills.                     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and hiring managers.                     Strong negotiation and influencing skills to secure top talent in a competitive market.                     Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with changing priorities and deadlines.                     Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools.                     Professional certifications in recruiting (eg, AIRS, LinkedIn Recruiter) are a plus.

column2: As an Associate Recruiter, your primary responsibility is to support the recruitment process within an organization     You work closely with the recruiting team or the HR department to identify and attract qualified candidates for open positions     Here are some key aspects of the role:Job Posting and Sourcing: You assist in creating job descriptions and posting them on various job boards and company websites     You also participate in sourcing activities to identify potential candidates through online platforms, social media, referrals, and other sources     Screening and Selection: You review resumes and applications received for open positions, screen candidates based on predetermined criteria, and conduct initial phone or video interviews     You may also administer pre-employment assessments or tests as required     Interview Coordination: You help schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring that all necessary arrangements are made, such as coordinating availability, booking interview rooms, and sending interview confirmations     Candidate Relationship Management: You maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates on their application status and gathering feedback     You may also answer candidate inquiries and address any concerns they may have     Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management: You use an ATS or recruitment software to track candidate information, update candidate profiles, and maintain recruitment-related data     You ensure that the system is up to date and accurate     Documentation and Compliance: You assist in preparing employment contracts, offer letters, and other recruitment-related documentation     You also ensure compliance with legal and company requirements, such as data protection regulations and equal employment opportunity guidelines     Recruitment Reporting: You generate recruitment reports and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs), such as time-to-fill, source of hire, and candidate conversion rates     These reports help evaluate the effectiveness of the recruitment process and identify areas for improvement     Employer Branding: You contribute to employer branding initiatives by promoting the organization's values, culture, and job opportunities through social media, career fairs, and other channels     You may also participate in employer branding events and activities       ?
column11: Associate - Recruiter

column2: *Collaborate with Head Talent Acquisition and hiring managers to execute life cycle recruiting plans, use passive and active recruiting techniques and a broad variety of sources for developing a ready candidate pipeline to fill in critical needs.   *Understand the manpower requirements and post job openings on internal job portal as well as external job portals.   *Ensure all recruitment related documents such as CVs, offer letters, etc. pre and post recruitment are in order and as per the required standards established for the selection of the right people to the target roles.   *Screening and identifying external as well as internal applicants for job openings to ensure that the qualifications required match with the respective vacancy.   *Conduct recruitment related activities including preliminary screening, interviewing, and facilitate hiring of appropriate talent to meet business demands.   *Ensure timely communication to the candidates on interview feedback.   *Ensure proper background verification of new hires as per organizational guidelines   *Issue offer/ rejection letter, facilitate negotiations with the candidate and act as the liaison between the business and candidates so as to facilitate the successful recruitment execution.    *Coordinate with other Functional Heads and Corporate TA team to drive TA function and leverage from the internal & external talent to fill in vacant positions, whenever possible.   *Timely update Recruitment MIS and provide analytical and well documented recruiting reports to the team.   *Stay updated on the latest recruitment trends and best practices in the industry and suggest suitable improvisations that can be introduced.   *Develop and maintain professional relations with local, regional and international recruitment agencies to ensure that right caliber professionals are attracted and selected.     Internal process-:   *Ensure that all activities are carried out as per the Standard Operating Procedures in the section.    *Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports as required within specified time period.

column2: As an Associate Recruiter, your primary responsibility is to support the recruitment process within an organization     You work closely with the recruiting team or the HR department to identify and attract qualified candidates for open positions     Here are some key aspects of the role:Job Posting and Sourcing: You assist in creating job descriptions and posting them on various job boards and company websites     You also participate in sourcing activities to identify potential candidates through online platforms, social media, referrals, and other sources     Screening and Selection: You review resumes and applications received for open positions, screen candidates based on predetermined criteria, and conduct initial phone or video interviews     You may also administer pre-employment assessments or tests as required     Interview Coordination: You help schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring that all necessary arrangements are made, such as coordinating availability, booking interview rooms, and sending interview confirmations     Candidate Relationship Management: You maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates on their application status and gathering feedback     You may also answer candidate inquiries and address any concerns they may have     Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management: You use an ATS or recruitment software to track candidate information, update candidate profiles, and maintain recruitment-related data     You ensure that the system is up to date and accurate     Documentation and Compliance: You assist in preparing employment contracts, offer letters, and other recruitment-related documentation     You also ensure compliance with legal and company requirements, such as data protection regulations and equal employment opportunity guidelines     Recruitment Reporting: You generate recruitment reports and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs), such as time-to-fill, source of hire, and candidate conversion rates     These reports help evaluate the effectiveness of the recruitment process and identify areas for improvement     Employer Branding: You contribute to employer branding initiatives by promoting the organization's values, culture, and job opportunities through social media, career fairs, and other channels     You may also participate in employer branding events and activities       ?
column11: Associate - Recruiter

column2: Role & responsibilities   IT Recruitment / HR Generalist ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Recruitment (60%) Manage full life cycle of recruitment. Review job details and prepare postings; in coordination with      hiring manager, determine recruitment strategy including pre-screening      questions, and where advertising would occur to provide diverse applicant      pool. Source and recruit candidates by using databases, social media,      networking, and online tools. Provide initial screening of applicant pools. Conduct interviews using various reliable recruiting and selection      tools. Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate      relationships during the selection process. Develop pipeline of talent, specifically for frequently filled      positions as well as hard to fill locations. Facilitate the selection of candidates in alignment with companys guidelines      and internal processes Lead the Diversity and Inclusion initiative HR Generalist (40%) Support companys overall HR management function Conduct employee onboarding and help organize training &      development initiatives Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as      leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise. Gather and analyse data with useful HR metrics, like time to hire      and employee turnover rates Maintain the organization structure by updating job requirements      and job descriptions for all positions. Maintain and update HR policies and standard operating procedures; Manage the organizations performance management program, to      include communications, training, and monitoring; Conduct and analyse exit interviews and make actionable      recommendations based on data Perform additional HR generalist duties as needed and assigned. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor?? Degree required; preferred degrees include Human      Resources and/or Business Management with 5+ years of relevant work      experience; or a Master?? degree and 4+ years relevant work experience. Highly tech savvy professional who has in depth understanding of      trending job positions in the IT industry.  Proven track record in closing high level Technical IT positions Experience working as an HR professional with IT company  3+ years??of experience in managing full life-cycle of IT recruitment. Experience in managing Compensation and Benefits, Payroll and      Performance Management Prior experience of working and applying HR principles in a system      environment, developing, maintaining and improving processes to achieve      greater efficiencies and performance. column2: About Stratogent: We are a young, dynamic managed IT services organization that's redefining the tech landscape. Nestled in the heart of Silicon Valley, we cater to exciting mid-market clients who demand cutting-edge technology solutions. With a focus on niche, high-end, and experimental work, we're the architects of a thriving technology ecosystem for our clients.  A Trailblazer in Technology Solutions:   Our focus spans niche, high-end, and experimental work within cloud, data center, and network operations, with a special emphasis on Pharma and Biotech verticals. We're the go-to pioneers crafting cutting-edge solutions that redefine industry standards. A Trustworthy Reputation:  We may be media shy, but our credibility is loud. Over 90% of our business comprises repeat clients, a testament to the trust they place in our expertise and the excellence we consistently deliver. Stability and Excellence Hand-in-Hand:  Since our establishment in 2005, we've consistently remained profitable, ensuring operational stability without accumulating debts. From day one, we've managed our operations prudently, maintaining profitability and financial stability. Innovation, Learning, and Collaboration:  Stratogent isn't just about stability and success; it's a melting pot of innovation, constant learning, and collaboration with the best minds in the field. We foster an environment where growth is inevitable, and innovation is celebrated. Come Work, Play, Learn and Grow at Stratogent! About the Role: As a  Associate Specialist (T2 - A) , you'll be a shaping the talent landscape of an organization and driving its success through effective talent acquisition. Your diverse responsibilities will encompass: Manage end to end process of hiring from sourcing to on boarding with inputs from HR Manager. Sourcing and screening the profiles according to the Job Specification. Lateral and niche skills hiring across technologies and roles. Partner closely with the Hiring Managers and HR Manager to get a holistic understanding      of the hiring needs and therefore execute the hiring plans effectively. Strong understanding and ability to recruit in all levels of the organization. Who You Are: Have a post-graduate degree- MBA from a reputed institute. Have 4+ years of experience in a Talent Acquisition preferably in niche domains      like Cybersecurity and networking. Lateral and niche skills hiring across technologies and roles. column2: We are looking for a dedicated recruiter to join our team in identifying hiring needs and filling  job openings. column1: Sr. IT Recruiters / IT Bench Marketing Associates (US Staffing)
column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Job Description: Looking for an experienced IT Recruiters & IT Bench Sales Associates with following requirements: - Candidate who willing to work from our Ameerpet, Hyderabad are preferred but we will consider remote work option for qualified candidates where applicable. Work timings are from 7.30 p.m. till 4.00 a.m. IST.  Please mention which role you are applying for in the subject line (IT Recruiters or IT Sales Associates). Send resumes to naukrijobs@everestcom.com   Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities for IT Recruiters:    Develop effective recruiting plans and strategies.  Assess assigned positions to develop job descriptions and job candidate profiles  Review and clarify job specifications, competencies and skills required  Align job candidate profiles with staffing objectives  Source applicants through various methods including advertising, recruiters, job sites, career fairs  Maintain effective relationships with social and professional networks to source qualified candidates  Pre-screen job candidates and co-ordinate with Account managers.  Review resumes and qualifications to determine suitability of candidates  Schedule and coordinate interviews cooperatively with hiring managers  Inform candidates fully about the job and company  Brief and debrief candidates before and after interviews  Verify references, conduct background checks, facilitate pre-employment testing  Manage all communication with candidates; provide regular updates and feedback to managers  Extend offers of employment within company procedures  Manage the job offer including negotiation and administration  Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities for IT Sales Associates:    Should have experience in entire Sales Life Cycle and have ability to market multiple candidates at a time.  Individual with a passion for Bench sales and looking to pursue their career in marketing consultants.  Working experience with direct vendors.  Posting/submitting their resumes on various job boards/requirements and finding requirements for them through other resources.  Checking with the consultants comfort on job requirements and suggesting any modifications required to improve their chances of short listing for the job positions applied.  Working directly with end clients requirements like Tier 1 Vendors/Implementation partners.  Interacting, developing Tier-1 Vendor or Implementation Partners network daily basis to get the Bench candidates placed in minimal turnaround time.  Experience in working with different job portals like DICE, Monster, Corp to Corp, Career Builders etc.  Should co-ordinate with interview process and all the concerned till the position is closed.   Education and Experience:   Bachelor's degree or equivalent  Minimum 3 to 4 years of experience in US IT Market in Recruiting or IT marketing you are applying for.  Knowledge of staffing systems and tools  Experience in candidate sourcing solutions  Knowledge of applicable computer applications  Knowledge of relevant US Work authorizations & employment legislation  Clear understanding of tax terms like Corp to Corp, W-2, 1099 etc.   Key Competencies:   Planning and organizing, communication. Problem analysis and problem solving, judgment, decision-making. Adaptability, Flexibility, teamwork, negotiation skills, confidentiality. Must be able to reach the monthly and quarterly targets. Need to have Excellent Communication Skills.
