column2: Assist in the development and execution of talent acquisition strategies to meet the organization's staffing needs and objectives. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing requirements and develop job descriptions. Source candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking, and employee referrals. Screen resumes and conduct initial phone interviews to assess candidate qualifications and fit for open positions. Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Conduct reference checks and background screenings on potential candidates. Maintain applicant tracking system (ATS) and candidate databases, ensuring accurate and up-to-date records.
column11: Talent Acquisition, ats, screening, hiring, recruitment, applicant tracking system, staffing

column2: Support the talent acquisition team in sourcing and attracting qualified candidates for open positions within the organization. Assist in posting job advertisements on various platforms, including job boards, social media, and company career pages. Screen resumes and applications to identify potential candidates who meet the job requirements and qualifications. Conduct initial phone screenings to assess candidates' interest, availability, and basic qualifications. Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth and efficient interview process. Assist in conducting reference checks and background screenings on potential candidates. Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate information in the applicant tracking system (ATS) or recruitment database. Respond to candidate inquiries and provide timely updates on the status of their applications. Assist in the coordination of recruitment events, such as job fairs, campus recruiting, and networking events. Provide administrative support to the talent acquisition team, including scheduling meetings, preparing documents, and organizing recruitment materials.

column2: 1. Candidate Sourcing: Utilize a variety of sourcing methods to identify and attract top talent, including online job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals.     2. Candidate Screening: Review resumes and conduct preliminary interviews to assess candidates qualifications, experience, and fit with client requirements.     3. Interview Coordination: Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and clients, ensuring a smooth and efficient process.     4. Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients to understand their specific hiring needs and preferences.     5. Market Research: Stay up to date with industry trends and market conditions to provide clients with valuable insights and recommendations.     6. Candidate Engagement: Provide candidates with a positive experience throughout the recruitment process, including clear communication and feedback.     7.Offer Negotiation: Assist in negotiating offers and closing the hiring process successfully.     8. **Data Management:*Maintain accurate records and documentation of candidate profiles and interactions in our applicant tracking system (ATS).     9. **Onboarding*Responsible for onboarding the new joiner. Manage the induction schedule and joining formalities. Track the background verification process and reference checks. Document collection and maintaining updated employee records and providing details for payroll.      10. Support the HR department with other engagement, admin and HR related tasks and activities.      11. **Reports*Responsible for creating reports based on the data and matrix to showcase the recruitment efforts to the management. Good understanding excel and reporting tools.      Qualifications:     - 2 to 4 years of proven experience in IT and Non-IT recruitment.     - Strong knowledge of sourcing techniques and tools.     - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     - Client-focused approach and ability to build and maintain strong relationships.     - Familiarity with applicant tracking systems and recruitment software.     _Strong knowledge in excel, word, power point and reporting tools     - Strong organizational and time management skills.     - Bachelor s degree in human resources, Business, or a related field (preferred).

column2: Job Title: Recruiter- Technology and Related Domains Organisation : Seikor Careers Exp : 1 - 6 years Location : Bengaluru Type : Hybrid What are we looking for/What will your job look like: We are looking for someone who finds the entire lifecycle of recruitment exciting and is interested in the talent space. In this role youll have the opportunity to work through from start to end of job searches across various industries such as FinTech, Consumer services, Ecommerce & Logistics, B2C/B2B SaaS, Product lead organisations, consulting etc and functions such as Tech, Product, Sales, Marketing, Finance, HR. Operations etc. Below are some of the key responsibilities thatll come with this role: Understanding of Job description from the employers and making it into a mini-advert for potential candidates such that all essential components are covered and it attracts the relevant talent pool Using different techniques to source for talent for both Tech & Non-Tech roles. Being diligent, persuasive & creative is what will be needed to be able to do this well Handholding candidates into the interview processes right from exploring & engaging them through their profiles to the final/offer stages to joinings such that they feel and experience that we care for their careers which ultimately come back to us whenever they think about jobs Using a combination of general professional acumen and technical knowledge(like tech stacks, key skills for tech roles etc) to screen/grade candidates profiles such that high quality profiles are sent to clients ??Engaging with employers, developing understanding of what theyre looking for in their candidates, taking and providing feedback, ensuring logistics of employers & candidates engagements go smoothly If you love getting employers great people, individuals their dream job, sharing ideas to improve the world of recruitment around you and being rewarded for what you bring to the table then get in touch! You??l find us a great place to grow and thrive. Career growth can be very quick for the right person, in a matter of couple of years you could grow meaningfully in your career. Skills & Requirements: 3 years??experience in any of the sectors mentioned above, with knowledge of organizational structure, career progressions, talent management methods & connections with personnel Good understanding of sourcing portals with expertise in Naukri & Resdex portals and job postings Strong communication skills, relationship building and active listening skills Ability to assess the candidates beyond their work profiles and engage them throughout the process Ability to screen tech profiles using technology keyword matching of profiles with JD?? A combination of patience, diligence and empathy for providing excellent candidate and client experience Nurture the pipeline of passive talents and take steps to approach people from diverse avenues and backgrounds using common/known methods & using new/creative ways Proactively input to improve how any aspect of the job can be done better. You will find the employer to be very keen to hear how to disrupt and improve the way all things, whether large or small, are done

column2: About   Us: Successive   Digital  is a global leader in full-service software development, serving clients worldwide. With a commitment to excellence and technical proficiency, Successive delivers exceptional digital solutions that empower businesses to thrive in the digital age. We hold expertise in the realm of web and mobile applications powered by Cloud, Data & AI, helping every business meet its unique needs and objectives. Our   Expertise   Includes : Consulting : We create competitive business and operations transformation strategies to help companies stay ahead of the digital curve. Cloud:  We help businesses harness the advantage of digital and innovation with cohesive cloud services, including enterprise modernization and cloud-native solutions. CMS:  We empower enterprise transformation with advanced technologies and methodologies, including headless solutions. Creative:  We create brand stories by focusing on customer-centric design and best practices, allowing intuitive navigation and higher conversion rates. Commerce:  We help with digitization, transformation, and supply chain reconfiguration to change the retail landscape by developing winning retail strategies that help businesses set and execute their strategy with processes and technology that scale as their eCommerce scale. Product   Engineering: We help you deliver better customer experience and business outcomes by helping them customize their applications. Our team blends deep industry and technical expertise in product engineering that creates impact and increases operational efficiency. Industries   we   serve : ??Consumer Goods ??Media & Entertainment ??Government & Public Sector ??Retail & Commerce ??Agriculture ??Manufacturing ??Travel & Hospitality ??Healthcare & Lifesciences ??Chemical, Oil & Gas ??Transportation & Logistics ??Aerospace & Defence ??Automotive & Mobility ??Banking & Finance   Who   are   we   looking   for: Role:  Talent Acquisition Specialist Location:  Pune Experience:  4-8 years Responsibilities: ??Develop and execute comprehensive talent acquisition strategies to fulfill the staffing needs of    various departments within the organization. ??Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs, create job descriptions,    and define candidate profiles. ??Utilize a variety of sourcing techniques, including online job boards, social media,   networking events, and employee referrals, to identify and attract qualified candidates. ??Screen resumes, conduct phone interviews, and evaluate candidates to ensure they meet the    qualifications and cultural fit for the organization. ??Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and stakeholders, ensuring a smooth    and efficient interview process. ??Serve as the primary point of contact for candidates throughout the recruitment process,    providing timely updates and feedback. ??Negotiate job offers and facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a positive    candidate experience. ??Stay informed of industry trends, best practices, and legal requirements related to talent    acquisition, and make recommendations to enhance recruitment strategies. ??Track and analyze recruitment metrics to assess the effectiveness of talent acquisition efforts    and identify areas for improvement. ??Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the talent acquisition team, fostering their    professional growth and development. Qualifications: ??Masters or bachelors degree in human resources, Business Administration, or related field. ??4+ years of experience in talent acquisition or recruitment, preferably in a fast-paced   environment. ??Proven track record of successfully sourcing and hiring top talent across various functions   and levels. ??Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices, including sourcing techniques, candidate   assessment methods, and employment laws and regulations. ??Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with   candidates, hiring managers, and colleagues. ??Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and   deadlines effectively. ??Proficiency in applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment software. Your   Life   at   Successive: ??Successive has a culture of diverse, global teams who have a passion for collaboration and    client service. We challenge, inspire, and develop each other, which empowers us to own our    destinies and our careers. ??We extend our support in mentoring, and on-the-job development which helps you to   achieve career success. ??We provide onsite opportunities as well (Our Global offices). ??We provide comprehensive benefits including Maternity and Paternity Leaves benefits and other    paid leaves. ??We allow our talent to work on multiple technologies. ??We provide a Professional Development Program which helps you to develop your    technical and behavioral skills and competencies. ??We ensure On-Time salaries which are above or at par with market standards. ??We have a well-defined Reward & Recognition process. ??We love fun and have team outings, parties, sports, and cultural events around the year. Follow   us   on: Website:  https://successive.tech/ Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Successivetech/ LinkedIn:  https://www.linkedin.com/company/successivetech You   may   write   us   or   share   your   applications   at:  careers@successive.tech

column2: Artech India is looking for Associate - Recruiter to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As an Associate Recruiter, your primary responsibility is to support the recruitment process within an organization     You work closely with the recruiting team or the HR department to identify and attract qualified candidates for open positions     Here are some key aspects of the role:Job Posting and Sourcing: You assist in creating job descriptions and posting them on various job boards and company websites     You also participate in sourcing activities to identify potential candidates through online platforms, social media, referrals, and other sources     Screening and Selection: You review resumes and applications received for open positions, screen candidates based on predetermined criteria, and conduct initial phone or video interviews     You may also administer pre-employment assessments or tests as required     Interview Coordination: You help schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring that all necessary arrangements are made, such as coordinating availability, booking interview rooms, and sending interview confirmations     Candidate Relationship Management: You maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates on their application status and gathering feedback     You may also answer candidate inquiries and address any concerns they may have     Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management: You use an ATS or recruitment software to track candidate information, update candidate profiles, and maintain recruitment-related data     You ensure that the system is up to date and accurate     Documentation and Compliance: You assist in preparing employment contracts, offer letters, and other recruitment-related documentation     You also ensure compliance with legal and company requirements, such as data protection regulations and equal employment opportunity guidelines     Recruitment Reporting: You generate recruitment reports and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs), such as time-to-fill, source of hire, and candidate conversion rates     These reports help evaluate the effectiveness of the recruitment process and identify areas for improvement     Employer Branding: You contribute to employer branding initiatives by promoting the organization's values, culture, and job opportunities through social media, career fairs, and other channels     You may also participate in employer branding events and activities

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization. The primary responsibilities of this role include:     Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.     Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.     Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.     Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.     Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.       The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment. They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition. Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable

column2: Company Overview:  Tech Stalwart Solution, headquartered in Hyderabad, is a leading IT consulting firm offering a comprehensive suite of services. Specializing in Recruitment Services, Staffing solutions, RPO, and IT services such as Project Managed Services, we cater to a diverse clientele spanning both IT and Non-IT sectors. Our extensive range of solutions is not confined to geographical boundaries, as we efficiently serve clients in India, USA, and Dubai. With a commitment to excellence and a customer-centric approach, Tech Stalwart Solution stands as a trusted partner for organizations seeking innovative and reliable IT solutions worldwide. Position Overview:  We are seeking an experienced IT Recruiter to join our dynamic HR team. The ideal candidate will have 3 to 6 years of experience in IT recruitment, with a strong understanding of the technology landscape and excellent sourcing and networking skills. This role will be responsible for attracting, screening, and hiring top IT talent to support our company's growth and success. Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Source, screen, and interview potential candidates using a variety of channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals. Evaluate candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit to make informed hiring decisions. Coordinate interviews, assessments, and other pre-employment activities to ensure a smooth recruitment process. Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings. Negotiate offers and facilitate the hiring process, including background checks and onboarding procedures. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and legal requirements related to recruitment and employment. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 3 to 6 years of experience in IT recruitment, preferably in a fast-paced environment. Proven track record of successfully sourcing and hiring IT professionals across various technology domains. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and hiring managers. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools. Knowledge of labor laws and regulations related to recruitment and employment in India. Certification in HR or recruitment (e.g., PHR, SHRM-CP) is a plus. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Performance-based incentives and bonuses. Professional development opportunities and tuition reimbursement. Fun and inclusive company culture with team-building activities and events.

The ideal candidate will have 2 to 5 years of experience in IT recruitment, with a proven track record of sourcing, screening, and placing top technical talent. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with various stakeholders to support our company's growth. Working Days : Monday to Friday   Responsibilities: Source and attract qualified candidates through various channels, including online job boards, social media, networking, and referrals. Conduct initial screenings to assess candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and technical teams. column2: Job description Job Title: US IT Recruitment (Junior/Senior/Lead/Operational Manager) Timings: 06:30 PM IST to 03:30 AM IST Location: Gachibowli, Hyderabad   (Onsite) Required   Experience: 3 Years to 10+ Years No. of openings - 10 About Us:   GSK Solutions is a leading player in the US IT staffing industry, providing innovative recruitment solutions to clients across diverse sectors. We are dedicated to excellence, integrity, and fostering a collaborative work environment. Job Description: We are seeking talented individuals for multiple positions in our US IT recruitment team, including Junior Recruiters, Senior Recruiters, Lead Recruiters, and an Operational Manager. The ideal candidates will have a strong background in IT recruitment, excellent communication skills, and a passion for matching the right talent with the right opportunities. Depending on your experience level, you will be responsible for different aspects of the recruitment and operational management processes.   Responsibilities : Junior US IT Recruiter: Assist in sourcing and screening candidates for IT positions. Conduct initial phone screens and assist with interview scheduling. Maintain and update candidate databases and records. Collaborate with senior recruiters to understand client needs and job requirements. Participate in job fairs and recruitment events as needed. Senior US IT Recruiter: Source, screen, and interview candidates for various IT positions. Develop and maintain relationships with candidates and clients. Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, and networking. Negotiate job offers and facilitate the onboarding process. Mentor and support junior recruiters, providing guidance and training. Lead US IT Recruiter: Lead and manage a team of IT recruiters, providing direction and support. Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies. Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their staffing needs. Oversee the full recruitment lifecycle, ensuring a high level of candidate and client satisfaction. Analyze recruitment metrics and performance data to optimize processes. Operational Manager: Oversee the daily operations of the IT recruitment team, ensuring smooth and efficient workflows. Develop and implement operational strategies to improve recruitment processes and performance. Manage recruitment metrics and generate reports to assess team performance and identify areas for improvement. Coordinate with senior management to align recruitment strategies with company goals. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Provide leadership and training to recruitment staff, fostering a collaborative and productive work environment. Requirements: Junior US IT Recruiter: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Strong communication and organizational skills. Basic understanding of IT roles and technologies. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with applicant tracking systems. Eagerness to learn and grow within the recruitment field. Getting requirements for bench consultants from various sources like Prime Vendors, job portals and other Networking sites. column2: As an Associate Recruiter, your primary responsibility is to support the recruitment process within an organization     You work closely with the recruiting team or the HR department to identify and attract qualified candidates for open positions     Here are some key aspects of the role:Job Posting and Sourcing: You assist in creating job descriptions and posting them on various job boards and company websites     You also participate in sourcing activities to identify potential candidates through online platforms, social media, referrals, and other sources     Screening and Selection: You review resumes and applications received for open positions, screen candidates based on predetermined criteria, and conduct initial phone or video interviews     You may also administer pre-employment assessments or tests as required     Interview Coordination: You help schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring that all necessary arrangements are made, such as coordinating availability, booking interview rooms, and sending interview confirmations     Candidate Relationship Management: You maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates on their application status and gathering feedback     You may also answer candidate inquiries and address any concerns they may have     Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management: You use an ATS or recruitment software to track candidate information, update candidate profiles, and maintain recruitment-related data     You ensure that the system is up to date and accurate     Documentation and Compliance: You assist in preparing employment contracts, offer letters, and other recruitment-related documentation     You also ensure compliance with legal and company requirements, such as data protection regulations and equal employment opportunity guidelines     Recruitment Reporting: You generate recruitment reports and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs), such as time-to-fill, source of hire, and candidate conversion rates     These reports help evaluate the effectiveness of the recruitment process and identify areas for improvement     Employer Branding: You contribute to employer branding initiatives by promoting the organization's values, culture, and job opportunities through social media, career fairs, and other channels     You may also participate in employer branding events and activities       ?

column1: IT Recruiter - Contract To Hire Specialist
column2: Job Title: IT Recruiter (Contract to Hire Specialist) Job Mode: WORK From Office (MON -FRI) Location: Bangalore (Domlur) Company Overview: BCTC is a leading consulting firm specializing in IT recruitment services. We assist organizations in identifying top talent for their technical requirements, providing comprehensive staffing solutions that align with their business objectives. With a focus on excellence and efficiency, we strive to deliver exceptional recruitment services to our clients. Position Overview: We are seeking an experienced IT Recruiter with expertise in contract to hire (C2H) placements to join our dynamic team in Chennai. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in IT recruitment, particularly in sourcing, screening, and onboarding candidates for contract to hire positions. The role requires a proactive individual who can thrive in a fast-paced environment and deliver results within tight deadlines. Key Responsibilities: 1. Utilize various sourcing techniques to identify and attract qualified candidates for contract to hire positions in the IT sector. 2. Screen resumes, conduct interviews, and assess candidates to determine their suitability for specific roles and projects. 3. Collaborate closely with hiring managers and clients to understand their staffing needs and requirements. 4. Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, from initial candidate engagement to offer negotiation and onboarding. 5. Build and maintain a strong network of IT professionals through networking, referrals, and online platforms. 6. Keep abreast of industry trends, market conditions, and emerging technologies to enhance recruitment strategies. 7. Provide regular updates and reports on recruitment activities, candidate pipelines, and project status. 8. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and legal regulations throughout the recruitment process. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 2. Proven experience as an IT Recruiter, with a focus on contract to hire placements. 3. Strong understanding of the IT industry, including technologies, roles, and skill sets. 4. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment tools for sourcing and candidate management. 5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and build rapport with candidates and clients. 6. Ability to prioritize tasks, manage time effectively, and work independently with minimal supervision. 7. High level of professionalism, integrity, and confidentiality in handling sensitive information. 8. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and requirements in a fast-paced environment. Experience: - Minimum of 0.5 to 5 years of experience in IT recruitment, preferably with exposure to  contract to hire placements. Preferred Skills: - Previous experience working in a consulting firm or staffing agency. If you meet the qualifications and are passionate about making a meaningful impact in the IT recruitment space, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our team BCTC. We look forward to reviewing your application!

column2: About Info Edge   InfoEdge mission is to create world-class platforms that transform lives by continuously innovating. Our products and services are built keeping our customers in mind. We always delight our customers by delivering superior value through enhanced offerings on the internet and other platforms. Through our continuous investment across various businesses, especially in cutting-edge technology, machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), we have built a robust system that constantly increases our predictive powers on customer behavior and optimizes and improves our systems. Our various teams tirelessly work together to solve problems, innovate, and create something to empower our customers.  At Info Edge, people are our core competitive advantage, and we will continue doing all that is needed to attract and retain the best available talent. About BU: Naukri.com Naukri is Indias market leader in the recruitment business. It provides all the job seekers with advisory services and caters to their different needs and offer value-added features such as resume writing, highlighting and many more. With over 67 Million resumes searches daily, Naukri.com has 5 Million job listings, 59 Thousand+ unique clients and 4.9 Million recruiters connect with the job seekers via emails. Naukri eHire  is like an extension to our Recruitment team and whenever there is a spurt in our requirements, instead of giving it to consultants at a high cost we use e-hire services to get shortlisted and validated CVs.      Job Description: -   Managing the entire Talent Acquisition cycle right from understanding the manpower requirement, sourcing candidates, interviewing candidates,  Negotiating offers and closing the position Expertise in recruiting all the entry-level, middle-level and senior-level positions for Tech and Non-Tech requirements. Working closely with Business Managers to ensure an in-depth understand of the hiring mandate and create impactful job descriptions.  Depending on the desired candidate profile, effectively source candidates from varied sources, such as job portals, campus hiring, walk-ins, head hunting, internal referrals etc.  Achieving the monthly/ quarterly and annual hiring targets to achieve the manpower projections. Adhering to internal HR processes such as ensuring proper documentation, monthly hiring MIS generation, preparing offer letters, within the specific TAT. Maintaining, documented and presented progress reports to leaders.  Desired Candidate Profile Excellent communication skills, Innovative, goal-driven, Aggressive.  Should have client management experience. Fast learner capable of handling pressure.  Good recruitment skills.  Graduate or Postgraduate both are eligible.      Required Skills:    Excellent verbal and written communication   Well versed with the Naukri portal for recruitment activities   In depth knowledge of HR principles, functions and practices   Experience of hiring for middle level to senior level positions   Experience:  2 to 5 years   Qualification: Graduate / Postgraduate   Days of working: 5 days (9:30AM - 6:30AM)   Location: ETT, Tower 2, Noida Sector 132  Regards,  Lovprit Kour   Talent Acquisition - Human Resources, Info Edge (I) Ltd.   ETT, Tower 2, Noida Sector 132

column2: NECTAR EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for IT Recruiter to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization      The primary responsibilities of this role include:      Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals              Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization              Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings              Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards              Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization              Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings      The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates      Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition      Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable

column2: Job Description : Job Role : HR Recruiter Experience : 1-2 year Qualification : MBA-HR Responsibilities : Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and develop job descriptions and specifications. Source and attract qualified candidates through various channels, including job portals, social media, networking events, and referrals. Screen resumes and applications to identify potential candidates who meet the job requirements. Conduct interviews and assessments to evaluate candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit within the organization. Manage the entire recruitment process, including scheduling interviews, coordinating with candidates, and providing timely feedback. Extend job offers and negotiate employment terms and conditions with selected candidates. Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system. Develop and maintain a network of potential candidates for future job opportunities. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in recruitment and implement them to improve the recruitment process. Assist in developing and implementing employer branding initiatives to enhance the company's reputation as an employer of choice. INTERESTED CANDIDATES CAN SHARE THEIR UPDATED CV. Contact Details: Mail ID: ansuanna.j@byicom Mobile No: 6360547195

column2: Role & responsibilities     We are looking for an experienced IT recruiter or technical recruiter to join our recruitment department. You will play a key role in sourcing, screening, and hiring top-tier IT talent.  As an IT recruiter, you are responsible for evaluating and selecting candidates with the right cultural fit and skills that are vital to our companys growth. Collaborate with clients and teams to understand the latest candidate requirements.  Source qualified candidates from social media, internal databases, and different job portals.  Make changes in approaches according to the latest industry trends.  Screen and filter out candidates by evaluating against the latest standards.  Analyze a candidates capabilities via pre-screening assessments and calls.  Conduct interviews using a variety of methods, like video, in-person, or telephone.  Keep track of applicants at every stage and follow up.  Assist with providing a positive onboarding experience.  Keep a record of job responsibilities through job analyses. Preferred candidate profile   A bachelors in HR or any related field.  Excellent sourcing and evaluation skills.  Proven experience in building the talent pool for the IT department via different recruitment platforms and processes.  Familiarity with interview formats, such as Skype, Zoom, Teams, etc.  Solid understanding of phone interviews, group interviews, and other interview methods.  First-hand experience using Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and recruitment software.  Good communication and decision-making skills.

column2: The Recruiter is responsible for Service Excellence throughout the recruitment cycle. They act as a brand ambassador for the client, focused on delivering exceptional talent while providing proactive and timely communication on the status of the search. They serve as subject matter expert in talent acquisition and provide consultative direction and industry expertise to hiring leader. ?  The recruiter should possess prior experience of hiring IT salesperson.? Responsibilities:   Finding Candidates:??- Lead a detailed job scope meeting with the hiring leader to determine position specifications, providing relevant market data and recommendations on possible approaches to the search or candidate requirements. Review of candidates who have applied via the Applicant Tracking System (ATS). Evaluate candidate qualifications against position requirements and determine who to move forward in the recruitment process. Develop and manage recruitment marketing plans or sourcing plans to determine the most appropriate candidate sources that align to the search requirements. Source candidates via resume databases, search engine and networking sites using Boolean search language. Solicit and pursue referrals from business networks and/or internal referrals. Utilize Cielos proprietary software for mobile and email campaigning to talent communities. Engaging Candidates: - Use an appropriate mix of media to connect with talent communities (phone, email, social media, etc.). Articulate value proposition to candidates who are interested in the job opportunity. Prepare candidates for interviews, coaching them on logistical information, interview schedule, appropriate attire and overall expectations. Ensure candidates are provided with timely updates concerning the status of their applications and interviews. Assessing Candidates: - Draft and utilize phone interview templates appropriate to the job description. Use independent judgement to compare candidate phone interview notes and skills assessments with position requirements to determine if the candidate is a match for the role or a potential match for other open positions. Issue skills testing as needed and evaluate results (if process dictates). Review background and reference information (if process dictates). Influencing the Hire: - Keep candidates engaged throughout process, ensuring consistent communication on the status of the search. Partner with hiring leader to determine offer details, using market data and compensation guidelines to support recommendations. Articulate a job offer to candidate and drive for candidate acceptance, anticipating and negotiating counter-offers as appropriate. Service Excellence: - Strict adherence to all regulations (OFCCP and all other compliance standards set forth). Work to deliver a strong candidate slate, continuously building talent pipelines to ensure there are multiple qualified candidates in play at all times. Provide accurate and regular reporting of recruiting activities to the hiring leader and Cielo leadership to depict both metrics and efforts. Identify perceived difficulties with searches and research and recommend solutions to both internal and external stakeholders. Proactively and regularly communicate the status of each search to the hiring leader, providing a consultative approach with recommendations on how to move forward.? Education: High school diploma required. Bachelors degree in business, management, human resources or related field is strongly preferred.? Experience: Minimum of 3 or more years recruiting experience with demonstrated successes in a corporate, RPO or agency setting. Experience using recruitment technologies such as Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and social media tools. Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: Proficient in Boolean search techniques for sourcing. Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of common Human Resources principles, practices and metrics related to talent acquisition. ? ??

column2: Role & responsibilities     Source, identify, and engage top-tier technical talent for various IT positions. Utilize a variety of recruitment channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and industry events. Conduct thorough candidate assessments to ensure alignment with job requirements and company culture. Develop and maintain strong relationships with hiring managers and key stakeholders to understand their talent needs and business objectives. Collaborate with department heads to create effective recruitment strategies and hiring plans. Conduct in-depth interviews and technical assessments to evaluate candidates' technical skills, experience, and cultural fit. Provide constructive feedback to candidates and hiring managers. Ensure a positive and seamless candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Communicate effectively with candidates, keeping them informed and engaged. Track and analyze recruitment metrics to measure the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and identify areas for improvement. Generate regular reports on recruitment activities and provide insights to leadership. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience as a Technical Recruiter in the IT industry for 2 to 5 years. In-depth knowledge of IT roles, technologies, and industry trends. Strong understanding of the recruitment lifecycle and best practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems and recruitment tools. Professional certification in Human Resources or Recruitment (desired). Perks and benefits     Competitive salary Health and wellness programs Flexible work hours Career development opportunities Positive and collaborative work culture

column2: Artech India is looking for Technical - Recruiter to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Candidate Sourcing: Use various sourcing methods, such as job boards, social networks, professional associations, and internal databases, to identify potential candidates for technical and IT roles     Job Postings: Create and post job listings for technical positions, ensuring that they are compelling and optimized for relevant job boards and websites     Candidate Screening: Review resumes, conduct initial phone screens, and assess candidates' qualifications to determine their suitability for technical roles     Technical Assessment: Evaluate candidates' technical skills and knowledge through interviews, technical assessments, and reference checks     Interview Coordination: Schedule and conduct interviews, including technical and behavioral interviews, with candidates to assess their fit for the organization     Candidate Experience: Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, providing feedback, communicating status updates, and addressing candidate questions and concerns     Collaboration: Work closely with hiring managers and technical teams to understand their staffing needs and preferences, aligning recruitment efforts with departmental goals     Talent Pipelining: Build and maintain a talent pipeline of potential candidates for future technical positions, fostering ongoing relationships     Offer Negotiation: Assist in preparing and negotiating job offers, ensuring they are competitive and align with the organization's compensation structure     Onboarding: Collaborate with HR and onboarding teams to facilitate the smooth transition of new hires into their roles     Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate and recruitment data in applicant tracking systems (ATS) or databases     Compliance: Ensure that all recruitment practices comply with legal and regulatory requirements, including equal employment opportunity (EEO) laws     Market Insights: Stay informed about industry trends, technical advancements, and market dynamics to understand the evolving talent landscape

column2: Be a Talent Magnet: IT Recruiter Do you have a passion for tech and a knack for building connections? We're looking for an IT Recruiter who's energized by the fast-paced world of technology and has a talent for spotting exceptional individuals. As a key member of our team, you'll be responsible for attracting top IT talent to join our innovative company. What You'll Do: Be a sourcing extraordinaire: Identify, attract, and qualify top IT candidates through various channels  from job boards and social media to referrals and your own IT network. Partner with hiring managers: Collaborate closely to understand their needs and craft targeted recruitment strategies to find the perfect fit. Orchestrate the recruitment journey: Manage the entire process, from initial contact to offer acceptance, including scheduling interviews, coordinating logistics, and keeping candidates informed. Build meaningful relationships: Connect with candidates and stakeholders through clear and compelling communication. Be an agent for improvement: Identify areas to streamline HR operations and propose solutions to elevate our recruitment game. You're a Perfect Match If You Have: A bachelor's degree in HR or a related field (think: business savvy with a people focus). Proven success in IT recruitment with a track record of filling IT roles. The gift of gab: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to connect with everyone from technical minds to senior leaders. A team player: You thrive in a collaborative environment and can build strong relationships across departments. A tech whiz (sort of): Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and HR technologies is a plus. Bonus Points for: Experience navigating the ever-changing world of IT recruitment. As a global leader in integration and digital transformation services, Torry Harris is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions to our clients around the world. We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team and help us build an exceptional workforce.      As a contract technical recruiter at Torry Harris, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and selecting candidates for technical positions within the company, ensuring that we attract the best talent available. You will work closely with hiring managers and other team members to understand the staffing needs of the organization and play a vital role in building a strong and diverse team.    Key Responsibilities:    1. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop recruiting strategies to attract top technical talent.  2. Source candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals.  3. Screen and interview potential candidates to assess their technical skills, experience, and cultural fit within the organization.  4. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and facilitate the selection process.  5. Maintain and update candidate records in our applicant tracking system, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and regulations.  6. Act as a point of contact for candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing regular updates and communication.  7. Assist in negotiating and extending job offers to successful candidates, ensuring a smooth and positive onboarding experience.    Qualifications:    - Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.  - Proven experience as a technical recruiter or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of technical skills and requirements for IT positions.  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with candidates and hiring managers.  - Familiarity with applicant tracking systems and other recruitment software tools.  - Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.    If you are a driven and passionate technical recruiter looking for a new challenge, Torry Harris Integration Solutions may be the perfect fit for you. Join our team and play a key role in bringing top technical talent to our organization. Apply today and become a part of our dynamic and innovative team!    Roles and Responsibilities   The role of a Technical Recruiter (contract) is a critical one within any organization, as they are responsible for identifying and hiring top talent to fill technical positions within the company. This role requires a deep understanding of the specific technical skills and qualifications needed for positions such as software developers, engineers, network administrators, and other technical roles. In addition to identifying and attracting top candidates, the Technical Recruiter (contract) also plays a key role in ensuring a positive candidate experience and representing the company's brand in the best possible way.    Roles and Responsibilities:    1. Understanding hiring needs: The Technical Recruiter (contract) is responsible for working closely with hiring managers and other stakeholders to understand the technical skills and qualifications required for open positions. They must have a deep understanding of the technical roles they are hiring for and be able to identify candidates who possess the right skills and experience.    2. Sourcing and attracting candidates: The Technical Recruiter (contract) is responsible for using a variety of sourcing methods to attract top technical talent, including networking, online job boards, social media, and professional organizations. They must also be skilled at writing compelling job descriptions and marketing the company's opportunities to potential candidates.    3. Screening and interviewing candidates: Once candidates have been identified, the Technical Recruiter (contract) is responsible for screening resumes and conducting initial interviews to assess candidates' technical skills, experience, and cultural fit. They must be able to effectively assess a candidate's technical abilities and potential fit within the company.    4. Managing the interview process: The Technical Recruiter (contract) also plays a key role in coordinating and managing the interview process, including scheduling interviews, gathering feedback from hiring managers, and keeping candidates informed throughout the process. They must also be able to provide guidance and support to both candidates and hiring managers to ensure a positive experience for all involved.    5. Negotiating and making offers: Once a candidate has been selected, the Technical Recruiter (contract) is responsible for negotiating job offers and managing the offer process. They must be skilled at navigating the negotiation process and ensuring that offers are competitive and in line with market standards.    6. Building and maintaining a strong talent pipeline: The Technical Recruiter (contract) is also responsible for proactively building and maintaining a strong pipeline of potential candidates for future technical roles. This involves networking, attending industry events, and proactively reaching out to potential candidates to build relationships and keep them engaged with the company.    7. Representing the company brand: Throughout the entire hiring process, the Technical Recruiter (contract) must represent the company's brand in the best possible way. This includes effectively communicating the company's values, culture, and opportunities to potential candidates and ensuring a positive candidate experience.    In conclusion, the role of a Technical Recruiter (contract) is a multifaceted one that requires strong technical knowledge, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to effectively navigate the hiring process. By effectively fulfilling the roles and responsibilities outlined above, a Technical Recruiter (contract) can play a key role in helping a company attract and hire the technical talent needed for success.

column2: As a US IT Recruiter, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and recruiting candidates for various IT positions primarily based in the United States     You will collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and deliver top-notch talent in a timely manner         Responsibilities:       Candidate Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing techniques including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals to identify qualified IT professionals.     Candidate Screening: Conduct thorough screenings to assess candidates skills, experience, and cultural fit for specific roles.     Interview Coordination: Schedule and facilitate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth and efficient process.     Candidate Relationship Management: Build and maintain relationships with candidates to understand their career goals and aspirations, providing guidance and support throughout the recruitment process.     Pipeline Management: Proactively build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs.     Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.     Collaboration: Work closely with hiring managers and other stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide strategic talent acquisition solutions.           Requirements:       Experience: Minimum 1-3 years of experience in IT recruitment, preferably in a US staffing environment.     Knowledge: Strong understanding of IT technologies and terminology, with the ability to assess candidates technical skills.     Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with candidates, hiring managers, and other stakeholders.     Time Management: Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.     Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team, sharing knowledge and best practices to achieve common goals.     Flexibility: Willingness to work evening hours according to US time zones.     Education: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field preferred.

column2: Accelon is a US based Contingent Staffing provider. We specialize in recruiting for IT, Creative Services, Sourcing & Procurement, and Finance. We are seeking a technical (IT) recruiter to support our US clients.  This is a WFH position, however candidates could be in Bangalore.  Primary responsibilities will include sourcing suitable candidates against client provided requisitions and for building the companys database. The Recruiter responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: Responsibilities Review and understand technical job requirements Create and share personalized recruiting emails with current job openings to passive candidates. Source candidates using LinkedIn, job portals and networks. Identify, attract, and engage with potential candidates. Screen candidates thoroughly against the technical job description Interview candidates over GH video and get to know them, their goals, and their strengths. Instruct applicants on the nature of the job and whom they will be speaking with during the interview. Facilitate meeting between hiring lead and applicant and participate in final selection of applicant. Create a portfolio of possible candidates for hiring manager. Actively maintain a network of candidates for future requirements, following up to keep your candidates in the loop and maintain lasting relationships Format resumes meeting client expectations Facilitate client interviews and onboarding Update applicant tracking systems and screening tools. Promote the company and its clients reputation as a great place to work. Keep up-to-date with new technological trends and products. Work as an integral member of the team, motivating one another and communicating effectively at all levels. column2: Corporate Recruiter responsibilities include:       Working closely with hiring managers to define needs and structure the recruitment plan     Organizing all communications with candidates.     Proven work experience as recruiter, Recruiter or similar role.     Minimum 2 - 4 years of US Recruitment experience required.             Job Brief:       We are looking for a Corporate Recruiter to be responsible for the full spectrum of the hiring plan from identifying needs and shortlisting candidates to closing successful hires.     Corporate Recruiter responsibilities include creating and publishing job ads, interviewing candidates and seeking out new candidate sources. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with full-cycle recruitment and great communication skills.     Ultimately, you will maintain and improve our employer brand, ensuring that we attract, hire and retain people who contribute to our company s growth.             Responsibilities:       Work closely with hiring managers in various departments to define recruitment needs and plan the hiring process     Track recruitment KPIs, like time to hire, source of hire and time to fill     Manage all communication with candidates from the moment they apply until they get onboard     Source candidates on job boards, resume databases, professional networks and through referrals     Organize hiring events and participate in job fairs to network with potential candidates     Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications

column2: TMV Global India Private Limited  is hiring 20 Technical Recruiters for US Staffing Clients. This is a Full time job with Night Shifts (6:30 PM to 3:30 AM), 5 Days a week, can be converted to Work From Home after performance evaluation. Interested Candidates are required to send their resumes for scheduling an interview. Job Description: Technical Recruiter is required to source potential candidates from various databases, portals, job boards and social media platforms. Technical Recruiters should be able to perform pre-screening calls to analyse applicant's abilities and should be able to get the authentication done by getting the required documents from them. Should be able to negotiate pay rates and terms with US Citizen, and Green Card Holder candidates. Should be able to manage all stages of the recruitment process for both clients and candidates. Required Skills: Should have 1 to 6 years of professional US IT Recruitment experience. Should be able to work in Night Shifts (6:30 PM to 3:30 AM). Should have excellent communication and active listening skills. Should be able to converse with Native speakers of English. Should have knowledge about various Software Technologies and Tools. Should have expertise in using various sourcing methods including traditional job boards, social media, networking, web-mining, and cold-calling. Demonstrated ability in hiring candidates across geographies within the US Good understanding of US Staffing statutory requirements, HR and contracting process, pay rates etc. Should have Experience in hiring W2/Full Time Candidates. Ability to work on multiple requirements and source quality profiles. Familiar with all sourcing documentation (NDA/MSA/PO/COI etc).

column2: As a Senior Recruiter, you will play a pivotal role in sourcing, attracting, and hiring top talent to strengthen our team and drive our mission forward. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers and executives to understand their staffing needs and implement effective recruitment strategies.       Responsibilities:         Talent Acquisition Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive talent acquisition strategy that aligns with the companys goals and supports our rapid growth in the cybersecurity industry.     Full-cycle Recruitment: Manage end-to-end recruitment processes, including job posting optimization, candidate sourcing, resume screening, conducting interviews (phone, video, and in-person), reference checks, offer negotiations, and onboarding.     Candidate Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing techniques, including job boards, social media platforms, professional networks, industry events, and employee referrals, to attract a diverse pool of highly qualified candidates.     Employer Branding: Collaborate with the marketing team to enhance our employer brand, ensuring that our company is positioned as an employer of choice in the cybersecurity sector.     Candidate Evaluation: Assess candidates technical skills, qualifications, cultural fit, and overall suitability for the role, providing insightful recommendations to hiring managers to support their decision-making process.     Talent Pipeline Development: Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs, proactively engaging with potential candidates and keeping them informed about relevant opportunities.     Stakeholder Management: Establish strong partnerships with hiring managers and executives, providing regular updates on recruitment progress, advising on market trends and best practices, and driving a high-quality candidate experience.     Recruitment Metrics and Reporting: Develop and track key recruitment metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of recruitment strategies, providing data-driven insights to enhance the hiring process.   Employer Value Proposition: Collaborate with the HR team to develop and enhance our employer value proposition, ensuring that our employee value proposition resonates with top cybersecurity professionals.         Requirements:         Minimum of 4 years of experience in full-cycle recruiting, with a focus on both technical and non-technical positions.     Proven track record of successfully sourcing and hiring for product startups.     Excellent sourcing skills and experience with diverse candidate sourcing strategies, including online platforms, social media, networking events, and industry partnerships.     Demonstrated ability to assess technical skills and qualifications effectively, utilizing relevant assessment techniques and tools.     Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and executives.     Strong organizational and management skills, with the capability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced startup environment.     Experience using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools.

column2: As a Product and Engineering Recruiter at Postman, you will play a crucial role in shaping our future by attracting and hiring top talent in product and engineering     This is more than just filling positions; it s about being a part of a team that is building a product that millions of developers and business professionals will use to drive innovation through an API first world     Your role will be pivotal in defining the talent landscape, providing insights on market trends, and building a robust pipeline of high-caliber candidates     This is a hybrid position based in Bangalore, offering the unique opportunity to make a significant impact in a high-growth, API-focused tech environment               What You'll Do:           Lead and refine the full-cycle recruitment process for product and engineering roles, ensuring a smooth, positive candidate experience. Strategically plan and execute innovative sourcing strategies to find talent from non-traditional and diverse sources. Foster relationships with past applicants and potential candidates to build networks, creating a rich talent pool for future needs.           About You           Possess 8+ years of recruiting experience, with a focus on product and engineering roles in the technology sector.         Demonstrated success in using innovative sourcing strategies to attract passive candidates.         Strong understanding of the competitive landscape and how to engage top talent in the tech industry.         Proven track record in managing senior stakeholders and acting as a talent advisor.         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of engaging and influencing candidates and hiring teams alike.         Bachelor s or Master s degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field.         Passion for creating an inclusive and diverse workplace, with a commitment to driving team collaboration and professional growth.           What Else               We offer competitive salary and benefits, and a flexible schedule working with a fun, collaborative team       Enjoy full medical coverage, unlimited PTO, and a monthly lunch stipend     Yes, seriously We want you to eat well wherever you are at) Plus, our wellness program will help you stay healthy from your location with fitness-related reimbursements     Our frequent and fascinating virtual team-building events will keep you connected, while our donation-matching program can support the causes you care about     We are building a long-term company with an inclusive culture where everyone can be the best version of themselves, and we want you to be part of it

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization. The primary responsibilities of this role include:     Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.     Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.     Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.     Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.     Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.     The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates     Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition.      Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable.

column2: Artech India is looking for Technical - Recruiter to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Candidate Sourcing: Use various sourcing methods, such as job boards, social networks, professional associations, and internal databases, to identify potential candidates for technical and IT roles        Job Postings:        Create and post job listings for technical positions, ensuring that they are compelling and optimized for relevant job boards and websites      Candidate Screening: Review resumes, conduct initial phone screens, and assess candidates' qualifications to determine their suitability for technical roles      Technical Assessment: Evaluate candidates' technical skills and knowledge through interviews, technical assessments, and reference checks      Interview Coordination: Schedule and conduct interviews, including technical and behavioral interviews, with candidates to assess their fit for the organization      Candidate Experience: Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, providing feedback, communicating status updates, and addressing candidate questions and concerns      Collaboration: Work closely with hiring managers and technical teams to understand their staffing needs and preferences, aligning recruitment efforts with departmental goals      Talent Pipelining: Build and maintain a talent pipeline of potential candidates for future technical positions, fostering ongoing relationships      Offer Negotiation: Assist in preparing and negotiating job offers, ensuring they are competitive and align with the organization's compensation structure      Onboarding: Collaborate with HR and onboarding teams to facilitate the smooth transition of new hires into their roles      Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate and recruitment data in applicant tracking systems (ATS) or databases      Compliance: Ensure that all recruitment practices comply with legal and regulatory requirements, including equal employment opportunity (EEO) laws      Market Insights: Stay informed about industry trends, technical advancements, and market dynamics to understand the evolving talent landscape

US IT Bench Sales Recruiters for Delhi Location     We are looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic Bench Sales Recruiter with knowledge of the US IT Industry to support our customer needs. column2: Job Title: IT Recruiter Location:  Andheri - Marol Position Type:  Full-time Job Description:  As an IT Recruiter, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and hiring top-tier IT professionals to meet the evolving needs of our organisation. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of IT roles, technologies, and trends, along with demonstrated experience in full-cycle recruiting. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their IT staffing needs and develop comprehensive recruitment strategies. Source potential candidates through various channels, including online job boards, social media platforms, professional networks, and referrals. Screen resumes and conduct initial phone interviews to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and cultural fit. Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers, providing guidance and support throughout the interview process. Manage the candidate experience from initial contact to onboarding, ensuring a smooth and positive recruitment journey. Utilize applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools to track candidate progress, maintain accurate records, and generate reports as needed. Stay current on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to continuously improve recruitment strategies and processes. Build and maintain strong relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and external recruitment partners to enhance the effectiveness of the recruitment function. Participate in employer branding initiatives and recruitment events to promote [Company Name] as an employer of choice within the IT community. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 2-3 years of proven experience as an IT Recruiter, with a focus on recruiting for various IT positions. Strong knowledge of IT roles, technologies, and industry trends. Experience with full-cycle recruiting, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and external partners. Proactive, results-oriented approach with a commitment to delivering high-quality talent solutions. Nikhil Jadhav 9167968280

They focus on recruiting for various IT positions, including software development, quality assurance, project management, infrastructure, ERP, CRM, business/system analysis, database roles, etc. Their recruitment efforts are primarily directed toward client companies across different sectors, such as technology, healthcare, finance, banking, life sciences, automotive, and energy/utilities. column1: Hiring - US Healthcare Recruiter - Noida and Gurugram
column2: Join an award-winning and talented organization that delivers world-class healthcare workforce solutions. Working within a vibrant and passionate team of over 300 recruitment and sales professionals, you will bring your energy and enthusiasm to help grow the firm by recruiting and networking with healthcare professionals to ensure project needs are staffed with outstanding employees promptly. Job Title: Healthcare Recruiter -US Staffing Location: Noida and Gurugram Shift Hours: US Shift (7:30 PM to 4:30 AM IST) We are actively seeking a strong Healthcare Recruiter to join our successful team in  Noida and Gurugram.  The below-mentioned requirement might be a perfect fit for you.   About the Role: The Healthcare/Nurse Recruiter is a key position, with the primary goal of providing Recruiting support for our various client locations across the USA. What will you be doing day-to-day?  Generate leads through sourcing initiatives, social media advertising, phone interviews, and a high-volume outbound call phone strategy. Search Applicant Tracking System, social media, and other platforms to find caregivers for our open Travel and Per-Diem positions for RN's, CNA's, PCT's and all allied positions. Establish relationships with Healthcare Providers and maintain a pipeline of providers to encourage a long-term working relationship.  Negotiate contract terms with candidates. Partner with Account Managers to ensure candidate viability and arrange client interview Your Experience: 6+ months of a proven track record in a US based Staffing Company 6+ months of experience in Healthcare Clinical and Allied staffing Experience working in the Per-Diem Nursing model is a big plus. Your Skills: Exceptional planning and execution skills. Exceptional customer service skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, competitive environment. Great attitude, passion, and drive to be a perfectionist. High-energy and competitive nature that seeks results and personal accountability   About Cynet Health: Headquartered in the Washington, D.C. metro area, Cynet Health is a TJC Certified Staffing and Workforce solutions company that helps our clients realize their talent potential through custom staffing & recruiting solutions. Since its humble inception in 2010, Cynet has a presence in all 50 States and over 1000 people strong spread across the US,    Remuneration: Attractive Base Salary + Industry Best Recurring Incentives + Health Benefits + Other Standard Benefits (Paid Leaves etc.) + Excellent Rewards & Recognition program.
