column2: Role & responsibilities   Candidate Sourcing Specialist Are you excited about taking your career to new heights with a dynamic and rapidly growing company? If you are,  let's get in touch   your interest is the first step to starting the conversation.   As a  Candidate Sourcing Specialist , you will be responsible for sourcing US based technical candidates from the allocated job boards and various other platforms/ social networks, for the Recruitment team to call and onboard them for various technical job openings within our organization. Your primary focus will be on ensuring that right candidates with desired technical skills, experience & work status are sourced, as per the daily required count of submissions.   Role Requirements:  Extensive Knowledge of  US job boards .  Must have sourced  Technical candidates .  Must have  worked for the US market . And should have substantial experience in  US Staffing Industry.  Must have extensive knowledge about  Boolean search strings  to source candidates using Boolean searches.  Should have knowledge how to source technical candidates who are Green Card holders & US citizens.   Should know how to use various social media platforms to source candidates.  Should have  knowledge about various visa & work permit  types for US.  Should have worked on LinkedIn  Recruiter, ZipRecruiter, Dice, Indeed  etc.  Strong in  follow-ups  and engagement ability.   Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication  abilities.  Strategic planning to align work with daily, weekly, and monthly goals.   Results-oriented mindset  with an experience to sell a vision of success.   Adaptability to work in a  fast-paced environment .  Availability to work during IST/ US EST hours.  Should have managed  high-volume candidate sourcing  programs.  Minimum US Staffing experience in sourcing candidates should not be less than 4 years. Whats In It For YOU?  Acquire valuable,  career-enhancing experience  with one of the  fastest-growing IT consulting  company.  Opportunity to earn substantial  monthly incentives in addition to your salary. Collaborate with an  energetic and professional team .  Preferred candidate profile     Who Are We?  We are a  premier IT consulting firm  specializing in delivering top-tier solutions to companies across various sectors such as finance, energy, e-commerce, logistics, travel, retail, entertainment, automotive, and healthcare. Our clientele includes industry giants like  Microsoft, Google, Johnson & Johnson, Fannie Mae, Walmart, PayPal, T-Mobile, McDonald's, CVS, Verizon, Charter, Nike, Dell, Wells Fargo, Capital One, and Charles Schwab , among many others. Company Highlights:   Specialization:  Providing IT consulting services.   Experience : Over 25 years of combined domestic and international expertise in IT consulting, serving hundreds of Fortune 1000 companies and innovative startups.  Interested in accelerating your career  through career-enhancing IT consulting experience? Do you meet the required qualifications? If so,  apply today!   We look forward to hearing from you. Perks and benefits   BEST IN THE INDUSTRY

column2: Are you a recent graduate or have up to 1 year of experience, and passionate about building a career in Human Resources? Minivel Services, a leading recruitment and staffing solutions company located in Vasai, is seeking a motivated and enthusiastic individual to join our growing HR team! At Minivel Services, we offer a dynamic and supportive work environment where you'll gain valuable experience in various HR functions. Whether you're fresh out of school or have some initial experience, this is a fantastic opportunity to learn from seasoned professionals and  contribute to the success of our company. In this role, you will: Gain exposure to core HR practices, including recruitment, onboarding, and employee relations (freshers) or build upon your existing knowledge (1 year exp). Assist with administrative tasks such as record keeping and data entry. Support HR initiatives and projects. Learn from experienced HR professionals and develop your skills (freshers) or further refine your HR expertise (1 year exp). We are looking for a candidate who: Holds a Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or a related field (freshers) or possesses a Bachelor's degree and up to 1 year of experience in an HR-related role (1 year exp). Has a strong interest in the HR industry and a desire to learn. Demonstrates excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Is a team player with a positive attitude and a willingness to learn. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package (details will be provided to shortlisted candidates). Opportunity to gain valuable experience in a fast-paced environment. Work alongside a supportive and experienced HR team. 5-day work week schedule. If you're a recent graduate or have up to 1 year of HR experience and are eager to launch your career, we encourage you to apply! This could include actively working in frame keywords; preparing the skill matrix; sourcing/screening the candidate resumes through various recruitment methods; coordinating with them for interviews, extending offers, negotiating compensation, and facilitating the placement of candidates. Regards, Yamunesh Natarajan contact - 9042906404 Human Resource  TaSa IT Services Pvt Ltd.

column2: Job Title: IT Recruiter (Vendor Management) Overview: We are looking for an experienced IT recruiter with experience in vendor management to join our team. This role demands a minimum of 2 years' experience in IT recruitment, with a focus on hiring for diverse technical roles. Your responsibilities will encompass managing vendor relationships, sourcing top-notch candidates, and collaborating closely with hiring managers. Position:  IT Recruiter Location:  Jaipur Type:  Full-time (On-site) Experience:  Minimum 2 years Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related field. At least 2 years of hands-on experience in IT recruitment. Proficiency in vendor management and negotiation. Thorough understanding of recruitment best practices. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in ATS and other recruitment tools. Key Result Areas (KRAs): 1. Vendor Management: Develop and nurture robust vendor relationships. Negotiate contracts to enhance recruitment efficiency. Monitor vendor performance and ensure compliance with agreements. 2. Sourcing and Screening: Utilize diverse sourcing techniques for attracting top talent. Conduct thorough resume screening and phone interviews. Maintain a comprehensive and updated candidate database. 3. Candidate Management: Oversee the end-to-end recruitment process efficiently. Ensure a positive candidate experience at every stage. Coordinate interviews and assessments seamlessly. 4. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate closely with hiring managers to comprehend staffing needs. Provide regular updates on recruitment progress and status. Offer valuable insights based on market trends and candidate feedback. Additional Requirements: Familiarity with IT technologies and industry trends. Strong multitasking and prioritization skills. Results-driven mind-set with a keen focus on meeting targets. Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities.

column1: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist/ TA Lead - 4-8 yrs experience
column2: Job Details Responsibilities of a Talent Acquisition Specialist/ TA Lead will include sourcing candidates through various channels, planning interview and selection procedures and hosting or participating in career events. To be successful in this role, you should be able to develop long-term recruiting strategies and nurture trusting relationships with potential hires. Ultimately, you will create strong talent pipelines for our company's current and future hiring needs. Key Functional Areas of Responsibility: Responsible for the sourcing, screening, and hiring of technical specialists to fill IT and data science positions. Training & leading a team of 3-5 recruiters for company's internal hiring requirements. Communicating with hiring managers to identify future job openings and the technical requirements for those jobs. Writing job descriptions and posting to relevant media platforms. Screening applicants for competency with the job requirements. Meeting individual as well as team hiring targets according to company requirements. Interviewing/Presenting the resumes of the most suitable candidates to the hiring manager. Offering job positions and completing the relevant paperwork. Keeping track of all applicants as well as keeping applicants informed on the application process. Requirements and Skills  Proven work experience as a TA Lead/ TA Manager/ Talent Acquisition Specialist or similar role preferably in a Technology products organization. Familiarity with social media, resume databases and professional networks (e.g. Stack Overflow and Github) Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various interview techniques and evaluation methods. Knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATSs) Excellent verbal and written communication skills A keen understanding of the differences between various roles within organizations Qualifications in Human Resources Management or any other relevant field  Professional Competencies You should be focused, hard-working, and able to meet deadlines to the satisfaction of all parties involved. Should have a good working knowledge of technology, technical roles, and technical skills, as well as knowledge of the recruitment process.

column2: Role & responsibilities     As a Technical Recruiter, you will play a critical role in ensuring the company's hiring goals are met efficiently and effectively. You will execute recruitment strategies, screen and qualify candidates, and ensure a seamless hiring process. This role requires a deep understanding of technical roles and the ability to identify top talent in the industry. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment Strategy Execution: Implement the companys recruitment strategy to meet hiring goals. Develop and refine recruitment processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and provide guidance on hiring strategies. Candidate Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals, to identify potential candidates. Develop a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs. Candidate Screening and Assessment: Review resumes and applications to identify candidates who meet the required qualifications. Conduct initial phone and video screenings to evaluate candidates technical skills, experience, and cultural fit. Coordinate and schedule technical assessments and interviews with the relevant team members. Candidate Engagement: Build and maintain relationships with candidates throughout the recruitment process. Provide a positive candidate experience by ensuring timely communication and feedback. Act as a brand ambassador to promote the company as an employer of choice. Interview Coordination and Decision Making: Organize and facilitate interview panels, ensuring that all interviewers are prepared and informed. Gather and analyze interview feedback to make informed hiring decisions. Extend offers and manage the negotiation process. Collaboration and Reporting: Work closely with the HR team and hiring managers to ensure alignment on recruitment processes and priorities. Provide regular updates and reports on recruitment metrics, including time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and candidate quality. Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in recruitment and talent acquisition. Continuously seek opportunities to improve the recruitment process and candidate experience. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field. Proven experience as a Technical Recruiter or similar role. Strong understanding of technical roles and the technology industry. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively. Proficiency with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment tools. Strong decision-making skills and the ability to evaluate candidates effectively
column11: End To End Recruitment, Technical Recruiter, It Hiring, Technical Hiring, It Recruitments, Communication Skills, IT recruiter, IT Staffing, IT Recruitment, Technical Recruitment

column2: As an IT Recruitment Consultant at Intelliest Technology Pvt Ltd, you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting, and placing qualified IT candidates in various roles within our client organizations     You will work closely with clients to understand their staffing needs, build relationships with potential candidates, and manage the entire recruitment process from start to finish     This role requires a proactive approach, strong communication skills, and a deep understanding of the IT industry           Key Responsibilities           Candidate Sourcing:    Use a variety of sourcing methods (e.g., job boards, social media, networking, referrals) to attract top IT talent.         Candidate Screening:    Conduct interviews and assessments to evaluate candidates skills, experience, and cultural fit.         Job Matching:    Identify suitable roles for candidates based on their skills and career goals, and present them to clients.         Recruitment Process Management:       Oversee the recruitment process, including scheduling interviews, negotiating offers, and onboarding candidates.         Market Research:    Stay informed about industry trends, salary benchmarks, and emerging technologies to provide valuable insights to clients and candidates.         Documentation and Reporting:    Maintain accurate records of recruitment activities and generate reports as needed.         Qualifications           Bachelors degree.       Proven experience in IT recruitment or a related field, with a strong understanding of IT roles and technologies.     Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.     Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.     Proficiency in using recruitment tools and applicant tracking systems (ATS).            Required Skills:        Recruitment     Sourcing     Hiring     Shortlisting

Company   Profile: https://m.aisensy.com/ https:// www.linkedin.com/company/aisensyofficial/?originalSubdomain=in Job Title: HR Recruiter Overview: We are seeking a talented and versatile HR Recruiter to join our team. As a crucial member of our human resources department, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and hiring top talent across both IT and Non-IT domains to support our company's growth and objectives. RESPONSIBILITIES: Partner with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for  IT   and   Non-IT positions. Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards such as Naukri and LinkedIn, social media, networking, and referrals, to identify and engage passive and active candidates. Conduct thorough screening and assessment of candidates through resume reviews, phone interviews, and in-person interviews to evaluate their skills, qualifications, and fit for the role and company culture. Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, including job posting, candidate communication, interview scheduling, offer negotiation, and onboarding coordination. Build and maintain a pipeline of diverse talent for current and future hiring needs, proactively sourcing and nurturing relationships with potential candidates.   Collaborate with internal stakeholders to optimize recruitment processes, streamline workflows, and enhance the candidate experience. Stay updated on industry trends, market conditions, and best practices in talent acquisition to continuously improve recruitment strategies and approaches. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate interactions, interview feedback, and recruitment metrics using the applicant tracking system (ATS) or other tools. YOU ARE ELIGIBLE IF YOU HAVE: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. 1+ years of experience  as an HR Recruiter, Talent Acquisition Specialist, or similar role, with a track record of successfully recruiting for both IT and Non-IT positions. Solid understanding of recruitment principles, techniques, and best practices across different industries and job functions. Strong sourcing and networking skills, with the ability to identify and engage top talent through various channels. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish trust with candidates, hiring managers, and stakeholders. Proficiency in applicant tracking systems (ATS), HRIS, and other recruitment tools and technologies. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities and business needs. Commitment to upholding integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism in all aspects of recruitment and candidate interactions.

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization.          The primary responsibilities of this role include:          Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.      Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.      Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.      Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.      Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.      Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.      The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.      Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition. Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable.

Experience with internal ATS and VMS applications preferred - Bullhorn, Gustav, Daxtra etc Excellent communication and presentation skill Proactive attitude and work ethic

column2: We are seeking a seasoned and accomplished recruiter with a passion for talent acquisition and a proven track record of success in technical recruiting, with over 15 years of experience to join our dynamic team. As a key member of our talent acquisition department, you will play a pivotal role in sourcing, attracting, and securing top-tier technical talent for our consulting firm. You will work side by side with technical leadership, our sales team and our leadership team to actively source, recruit, and onboard the best Architects, Front End/Backend Engineers, Cloud/DevOps Engineers, Mobile Engineers, and UX/UI Designers. At InRhythm, You Will Own your role and its development Learn new skills to accelerate your career Collaborate across diverse teams  Act as a subject matter expert to the InRhythm Community internally and externally What will you own? Manage the full recruitment life cycle, from sourcing and selling the company to interviewing and negotiating/closing offers with bar-raising technical consultants across various consulting practice areas. Partner closely with hiring managers and department leaders to understand staffing needs and develop tailored recruitment strategies. Understand not just the roles we work on but the engagements and clients as a whole. Build talent pipelines for current and future openings. Anticipate the needs of engagements and maintain a virtual bench accordingly. Conduct in-depth technical assessments to vet candidates' skills, experience, and technical fit. Understand and anticipate potential blockers to ensure all candidates are properly fit for the role and onboarded in a timely fashion Forecast hiring needs based on business growth plans Measure key recruitment metrics, like source of hire and time-to-hire, and work to improve metrics across the team Act as a trusted advisor to hiring managers, providing guidance and expertise on technical recruitment best practices. Ability to utilize sophisticated Boolean search and x-ray techniques to identify and connect with top-tier technical talent. Ability to tap into your network and uncover hidden gems will set you apart in this role. Ability to utilize a variety of sourcing methods, including online channels, social media, networking events, and employee referrals, to attract top technical talent. Manage candidate pipelines and maintain accurate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS). Stay abreast of industry trends and market insights to continuously improve recruitment strategies and processes. Mentor and coach junior members of the recruitment team, sharing knowledge and best practices to support their development. What You Bring to the Table 8-20 years of experience in technical recruitment, with a proven track record of success in attracting and hiring top technical talent in US geography. Established network in the tech industry, with connections to top-tier talent and industry professionals. Experience in digital transformation product consultancy and a deep understanding of the fintech landscape. Proven track record of validating priorities and delivering results under tight deadlines, with a keen focus on efficiency and quality. Exceptional negotiation skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and third-party recruitment agencies, if needed, to attract and retain top talent. Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Strong understanding of technical skills and competencies relevant to the information technology sector, with the ability to assess candidate proficiency across various skillsets and verticals. Expertise in utilizing applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools to manage candidate pipelines and track recruitment metrics. Ability to adapt to new applicant tracking systems and tools. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage and build relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and stakeholders. Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment, with a results-oriented mindset and a commitment to achieving hiring goals. Have experience hiring full-time, career-minded employees in a modern consulting environment
column11: technical recruitment, ATS, talent acquisition, hiring, recruitment, Technical Recruiter

column2: EVERSANA  is the leading independent provider of global services to the life science industry. The companys integrated solutions are rooted in the patient experience and span all stages of the product lifecycle to deliver long-term, sustainable value for patients, prescribers, channel partners and payers. The company serves more than 500 organizations, including innovative start-ups and established pharmaceutical companies to advance life science services for a healthier world. To learn more about EVERSANA, visit eversana.com or connect through LinkedIn and Twitter. OUR   CULTURAL BELIEFS Patient   Minded:  I act with the patient?? best interest in mind. Client Delight:   I own every client experience and its impact on results. Take   Action:   I am empowered and empower others to act now. Grow   Talent:   I own my development and invest in the development of others. Win   Together:   I passionately connect with anyone, anywhere, anytime to achieve results. Communication   Matters:  I speak up to create transparent, thoughtful, and timely dialogue.  Own   It:  I hold myself and others accountable for results. Embrace Diversity   We create an environment of awareness and respect. THE POSITION: As a US IT Recruiter at EVERSANA, you will play a pivotal role in identifying, attracting, and securing top-tier IT professionals to meet the staffing needs of our clients. Leveraging your expertise in recruitment strategies and understanding of the IT landscape, you will source, screen, and present qualified candidates while providing exceptional service to both internal clients and candidates alike. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Our employees are tasked with delivering excellent business results through the efforts of their teams. These results are best achieved by: Utilize various US based sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals, to identify potential candidates. Conduct thorough screenings and interviews to assess candidates' technical skills, experience, and cultural fit. Evaluate resumes, portfolios, and other application materials to ensure alignment with client requirements. Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to understand their staffing needs, project requirements, and company culture. Serve as a trusted advisor to the internal stakeholders, providing insights on market trends, salary benchmarks, and candidate availability. Maintain regular communication with the internal stakeholders to provide updates on candidate pipelines, interview schedules, and feedback. Proactively build and maintain a robust pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future staffing needs. Develop innovative recruitment strategies to attract passive candidates and diverse talent pools. Provide guidance and support to candidates throughout the recruitment process, from initial contact to onboarding. Ensure a positive candidate experience by delivering timely feedback, addressing concerns, and managing expectations. Collaborate with internal teams to facilitate the onboarding process and ensure a smooth transition for new hires. Track and analyze key recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, candidate quality, and client satisfaction. Prepare regular reports and presentations to communicate recruitment progress, challenges, and opportunities. Continuously evaluate and optimize recruitment processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. The   above   list reflects   the   general   details   necessary   to describe   the expectations   of the   position   and   shall   not   be   construed   as   the   only   expectations   that may   be   assigned   for the position. An   individual   in   this   position   must   be   able to   successfully   perform the   expectations   listed   above. MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: 3 to 5 Years of experience. Proven experience as a US IT recruiter for US based requirements. Ability to work in the US time zone from the Pune office (5 PM to 2 AM IST). Strong understanding of IT roles, technologies, and terminology. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and clients. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in applicant tracking systems (ATS), job boards, and other recruitment tools. Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in recruitment practices. EDUCATION: Any graduate.

column2: Were looking for an enthusiastic individual keen to dive into the dynamic world of headhunting for the US market.          Even if youre new to the industry, wed love to hear from you if you possess a go-getter attitude, natural people skills, and a strong drive to succeed.              Responsibilities:                Candidate Research: Use various tools, databases, and networking platforms to identify potential candidates for specialized roles.      Initial Contact: Reach out to potential candidates, understand their current career situations, and gauge their interest in new opportunities.      Relationship Building: Cultivate strong relationships with professionals in the industry to facilitate future engagements and referrals.      Client Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams and external clients to comprehend job specifications and ideal candidate profiles.      Interview Coordination: Schedule and facilitate preliminary interviews, gathering detailed feedback and ensuring a smooth communication flow between all parties.      Ongoing Learning: Continually update knowledge on industry trends, emerging roles, and recruitment best practices.      Documentation: Maintain meticulous records of interactions, feedback, and candidate details in the companys Applicant Tracking System (ATS). A proactive mindset, able to anticipate needs and act decisively.      Familiarity with MS Office; knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) is a plus.      Strong organizational skills and detail-oriented nature.      Ability to adapt to the dynamic nature of the recruitment world.      Must Willing to work according to US time zones                Benefits:          Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.      Comprehensive training program.      Health and dental benefits.      Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.      Friendly and collaborative work environment. This isnt your typical 9 to 5 role. We envision you as our future manager and leader within the next five years.

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization. The primary responsibilities of this role include:     Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.     Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.     Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.     Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.     Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.     The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.     Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition. Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable

column2: Sledding Technologies Pvt Ltd is looking for IT Recruiter to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization           The primary responsibilities of this role include:       Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.     Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.     Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.     Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.     Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.     The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.     Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition.     Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization.          The primary responsibilities of this role include:         Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.     Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.     Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.     Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.     Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.           The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment       They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates     Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition     Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable
column11: Data analysis, Talent acquisition, Transition, Packaging, Management, IT recruitment, Recruitment
